El está realizando una nueva siembra para lo cual nos está solicitando un crédito e invertirlo en la compra del abono, ya que no dispone de el dinero para poder comprar los sacos de abono y este material es muy importante para realizar la siembra, ya que fortalece la plantación y aumenta la cosecha, este crédito le ayudará con los recursos para que él pueda realizar su trabajo, dentro de los riesgos está las situaciones climáticas que afectan directamente la producción del cultivo.

El quiere ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y ya que se superen, ésta es su principal aspiración, también espera que su condición económica mejore poco a poco y poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan grows corn, and he works as a day laborer.  He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents.  He lives there with his wife and children.  

He does day laborer work, and they pay him six dollar a day to do any type of field work.  He also grows corn on part of his own land.  This crop helps him feed his household.  If the crop is abundant, he is also able to sell part of it and generate income.

He is starting a new crop, and that is why he is requesting a loan to buy natural fertilizer.  He does not have money available to be able to buy the sacks of fertilizer.  This material is very important for the crop.  It strengthens the plants and increases the harvest.  This loan will help him with the resources so that he will be able to do his work.  Among the risks are the climate situations that directly affect the crop production.

He wants to help his children go to school and be successful.  This is his main aspiration.  He also hopes that his financial situation improves, little by little, and that he will be able to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la comercialización de medicina natural y es responsable de su hogar, vive con dos hijos el mayor de ellos ya trabaja y colabora, Ella es madre soltera y por lo mismo desempeñan los trabajos como vendedora en diferentes partes ofreciendo productos medicinales a base natural, lleva ya varios años de experiencia y cuenta con una cartera de clientes en una zona cercana de donde reside.

Solicita un préstamo porque desea comprarse un lote de medicamentos en los cuales tendrán suplementos alimenticios, aceites, vitaminas como en hígado de bacalao, algunos laxantes como linaza, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la disposición de medicamentos y asimismo poder satisfacer en mayor porcentaje las demandas de los clientes.

Su aspiración con respecto al crédito es poder darle un nivel adecuado al negocio, con el cual pueda generar más estabilidad y a futuro poder desarrollarse más en el mercado, dentro de sus objetivos familiares estan a futuro poder adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
María sells natural pharmaceuticals and is responsible for her home, where she lives with two sons, the older of which already works with her. She is a single mother and so she works as a mobile vendor of natural pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She already has several years of experience in this and has a base of costumers in the area around where she lives.    

She is seeking this loan because she wants to make a bulk order of pharmaceuticals that will include food supplements, lotions, vitamins such as fish oil and natural laxatives like linseed oil. This investment will allow her to improve her offerings and gain a larger share of her customers' business. 

Her hope with respect to this loan is to be able to adequately supply her business, thereby generating greater stability and in the future to be able to have a greater presence at the market. Among her personal goals is being able to buy her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy lotions and vitamins like fish oil.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business selling charcoal. He earns about $7 daily. Tha is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase timber to build a new house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha is 59 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles and coffee for more than two years, earning approximately $25 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is involved in breeding pigs. He earns about $3 each day. Sitha is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a generator to produce electricity to use in her noodle shop as well as in her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her business and her home

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en:
Leopold is 46 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Johny Satiel

texts.es:
Johny, es un joven emprendedor, dedicado a la producción audiovisual, haciendo grabaciones de audio, creando pistas musicales, grabando filmaciones de eventos sociales, ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que le demandan su trabajo, el tiene dos años en este oficio vive junto a su familia a quienes les ayuda con sus ingresos.

El está solicitando un crédito por qué lo necesita para realizar la compra de unas puertas de metal para la vivienda, ya que le permitirá proteger la integridad física de su familia y la de él, además estará protegiendo su equipo de trabajo, este crédito será de mucha ayuda para que realice una buena inversion.

Hasta el momento el ha invertido en la compra de equipo de trabajo y espera futuro continuar mejorando la tecnología con nuevas herramientas que se utilizan para seguir generando un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Johny is a young entrepreneur who works in audiovisual production, making audio recordings, creating music tracks, and recording footage of social events. He has a client base, and there is demand for his job. He’s been doing this work for two years. He lives with his family who he helps out with his income. 

He is asking for a loan because he needs it in order to buy some metal doors for his house since that will protect the financial security of Johny and his family. Also, it will protect his work equipment. This loan will be a great help in making a good investment. 

So far he’s invested in the purchase of work equipment, and in the future he hopes to continue improving the equipment with new tools that can be used to continue doing good work.

loans.use: to buy metal doors.

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is married, with three kids. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Desederia is a farmer, and she operates a banana plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years, and every month she earns PHP  3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Desederia been a member of GDMPC since 2009. 

In the future, Desederia hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Siatua

texts.en:
Siatua is a 23 year old single woman, with one child. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Siatua needs a loan to buy a new frying pan and other ingredients for the business. 

She plans to use her profits to help her child's education and family needs. Siatua has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, and a new frying pan.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 32 years old. She lives in the village where she generates income. Cherry is married to Dominador, who manages their farmland. She and her husband work hard to always meet their needs. 

Cherry has been engaged in her sari-sari store for six years. She usually earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. She wants to have more products to sell. To make it possible, Cherry is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments to sell. 

With continuous patience and hard work, Cherry's family will achieve a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 46 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. 

She will use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and pay labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas se dedica a la venta de ropa y cereales en las diferentes ferias. Le gusta su Banco Comunal ya que en ella aprendió a ahorrar, también por que tiene amigas y comparten experiencias diferentes. Estando en la institución logró educar a sus hijos por la cual esta agradecida y lo más importante es que mejoró su calidad de vida.
Con el nuevo préstamo que solicita, lo va invertir en la compra de ropas para así poder mantener el negocio y seguir ayudando a su hijo en cuanto a su educación.
texts.en:
Felicitas works selling clothing and grains in different outdoor markets. She likes her communal bank because she has learned how to save, and because she has friends and they share different experiences. Being in the institution, she managed to educate her children, for which she is grateful. The most important thing is that she improved their quality of life.

With the new loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of clothing so that she can keep her business going and continue helping her son with his education.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a hardworking father and husband to Mary Ann.  They live in the local community of Namnama Alfonso Lista.  

His family's main source of income comes primarily from his farming business. He manages four hectares of corn and half a hectare of rice field. He is glad because his profits were used to cover all their household expenditures, and some amount serves as their savings for emergency purposes.

Rolly raises pigs. He would like to make them healthy and free from any diseases, so he can sell them for greater income.  To fulfill his goal, he requests a loan of PHP 25,000 allowing him to buy the necessary vitamins, vaccines, and stock hog feed. 

He knows that through this loan, he can obtain higher income that will serve to his family daily commodities and education of his only child.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medical equipment for health services

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking and responsible man. He is young and business-minded, yet single.  His aim is to help his six siblings finish their studies.

George manages his livestock and, at the same time, his farming and 8,000 square meters of fish pond.  Currently he lives with his parents and siblings.  Since he is the eldest among the family, he is responsible for managing their family farming business.  According to him, farming has been their primary source of income before.  For now, his family has invested some of their profits into their 8,000 square meters of fish pond and their livestock business.

George currently raises six fattening hogs.  He has been taking care of his hogs for two years. He is really thankful to God because his patience and sacrifices have brought a productive outcome to his family.

George is facing a great challenge in life, which is a shortage of capital.  So he is encouraged to apply for a loan of PHP 25,000.  This amount will be use to buy livestock feed and vaccines to ensure proper growth of his raised hogs. He believes in his own principle in life, which is that setting goals higher will push you to strive hard in order to fulfill them.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines to ensure proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 63 years old. Rosita is married and has seven children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and raising cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband (who is pictured with Say and their daughter in the picture) is a soldier who earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about $7 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Say is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run taxi service when he is free from his work. This purchase will help her husband generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a Tuk Tuk to run the taxi service and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn, a 33-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Gala, Ozamis City.  For over four years she has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jerlyn joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a loving wife and responsible mother to her two children. She says, "Everyone aims to have a steady income and a better way of life, but it's our own choice how to get them.” She enjoys farming and loves animals. She farms rice and corn, and two years ago she decided to raise hogs as well.

Marites is now applying for a 25,000 PHP loan from ASKI for pig feed and vaccines. She feels such a loan would result in further growth of her hog business as driven by continued support from lenders and wise management.

As parents, Marites and her husband hope for profitable work so they can educate their two children and provide them with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Jose Transito

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él está dedicado a la siembra de maíz y a la ganadería desde que estaba muy joven, pues lo aprehendió al lado de su padre quien todo el tiempo se dedicó a estas labores.

José hoy necesita un crédito porque está iniciando sus trabajos agrícolas de esta temporada, no cuenta con los recursos económicos para invertir en la compra de semilla, abono, preparación de la tierra, que son los que ayudaría el préstamo a cubrir, con este crédito tendrán la oportunidad de realizar su trabajo sin ningún contratiempo.

El objetivo de él es poder mejorar las ganancias con una buena producción de la siembra de maíz, teniendo la oportunidad de vender parte de la cosecha y así aumentar sus beneficios económicos.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has worked growing corn and raising cattle since he was very young; he learned this work alongside his father, who worked all the time at these tasks.

José now needs a loan because he is beginning his farming work for this season. He doesn't have the economic resources to invest in the purchase of seed, fertilizer, and the preparation of the land, which is what the loan would pay for. With this loan, they will have the opportunity to get the work done without any delays.

His objective is to be able to improve his profits with a good yield from his corn planting, with the opportunity to sell part of the harvest and thereby increase his economic profit margin.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Joseph provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns about PHP 300 daily. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that he will use to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 40-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Punjab Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and two sons. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past four-years he has also driven a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired.

Robina, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. 

With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. Robina desires to provide quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business.  She is very much thankful to Brac.

loans.use: To repair the engine of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for five years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a construction worker, and she is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ramona operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it for a little profit. Most of her products are personal products like lingerie. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales weekly.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW (ready to wear) products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ramona hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia se dedica a vender abarrotes en su tienda, ella cuenta que Finca le ayudó a abrir su tienda, cuenta que le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, también pasa un bonito momento con sus amigas del BC, solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la implementación de su tienda.
texts.en:
Antonia works selling groceries in her shop. She says that FINCA Peru helped her open her shop. She says she likes her communal bank meetings, and she has a lovely time with her friends from the communal bank. 

She is requesting a loan that she will invest in stocking her shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family.
 
He has a store in his home that he runs himself. His store sells electrical appliances to his neighborhood.

Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life and can support their household and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business in order to satisfy the needs of his customers. He will use it to buy more electrical appliances. His dream is to have a bigger selling area and see that his four children have a better future through a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 29-year-old married female from Amman, Jordan. She has two children. She requested a 600 JOD loan to buy a sewing machine and make clothes to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her project and have her own workshop.

Since Heyam is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Essivi Victoire's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Victoire la responsable est âgée de 44 ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont 17 ans et 6 ans. Elle vend des divers depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de couvrir la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Victoire se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Victoire, the group's official, is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are in school. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 6. Victoire has been selling various goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and from abroad.
 
Concerned about bolstering her ability to stock supplies and meeting customer demands, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev to maximize her profit and help cover her children's schooling costs. 

Victoire is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase oil, Omo, and all kinds of soaps to sell

loans.name: Andy Kim

texts.en:
Andy Kim, 29, is a single entrepreneur in Pangabuan, Tangub City. He earns income from his transport service business. It's been running for almost three years now, and he earns 4000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Andy Kim is borrowing 5000 PHP from GDMPC (which he joined in 2011) to obtain accessories and tires. Andy Kim is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business soon.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de verduras, ella afirma que con Finca logró sacar profesionales a 3 de sus sobrinos, cuenta que también logró comprar su terreno y pudo abrir su negocio, indica que en sus reuniones aprendió sobre la puntualidad, hacer responsable, también le gustan las capacitación porque le inculcaron muchos valores, solicita un préstamos que lo invertirá en hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas works in agriculture and sells vegetables. She says that with FINCA Peru, she has managed to make professionals out of three of her nieces and nephews. She says that she also managed to buy her land and was able to open her business. She mentions that with FINCA, she has learned about punctuality and being responsible; she also likes the training because they instill many values. 

Felicitas is requesting a loan that she will invest in making her business grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Laurenda Aurore's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Laurenda la responsable est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 02 ans. Laurenda a une boutique où elle vend des divers, des produits cosmétiques et des mèches depuis quelques années. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de contribuer à la bonne éducation de son enfant. Laurenda se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Laurenda, the group's official, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one child, who is 2 years old. Laurenda has had a shop for a few years where she sells a variety of goods, cosmetic products, and hair extensions. 
 
Concerned about bolstering her sales and to fulfill the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to increase her additional income and to help pay for a proper education for her child. 

Laurenda is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase ointments, hair extensions, spaghetti, and soap

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl se dedica a la venta de papas, cuenta que con Finca hizo crecer su negocio, lo que mas le gusta de las reuniones es ahorrar y las capacitaciones que le ayudan mucho sobre todo a educar bien a sus hijos.
Solicita un préstamos que lo invertirá en comprar mas papa y después comercializarla.
texts.en:
Raúl works selling potatoes. He says that with FINCA, he has made his business grow. What he likes most about the meetings is saving money and the training, which above all helps him to educate his children well.

He is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of more potatoes, which he will then sell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Adeline

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Adéline est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle vend des mêches, des bazins et des paires de chaussures depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un prêt à finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Adéline, aged 33, is a married mother of one child, who is in school. She has been selling hair extension, damask fabrics, and shoes for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the market in Benin and from abroad. Concerned about increasing her sales and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, she requested and obtained a loan from Finadev to make the best of her investments and to help cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, damask cloth, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor for preparing tomato fields

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa. Estando en la institución logró educar a sus hijos, también aprendió a trabajar y a ahorrar. Las capacitaciones que ofrecen son muy interesantes y nos ayudan tanto para el negocio y nuestras familias. Martha con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de abarrotes tales como azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, entre otros productos más. El sueño que tiene Martha es equipar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha has a grocery store in her own house. Being in the institution [FINCA Peru], she has managed to educate her children, and she also has learned to work and save money. The training that they offer is very interesting and they help businesses and families so much. 

With the new loan she is requesting, Martha will invest in the purchase of groceries such as sugar, rice, oil, milk, and other products. Martha's dream is to better equip her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, vegetables, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Matiko, leader du groupe d’affaire « Amkeni », est entrepreneur, âgée de 57 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous et  autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des pommes de terre. Son mari est un Militaire, ancien combattant mise en retraite. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. En outre, elle vend aussi des unités cellulaires d’appel  à son domicile. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle a eu son premier capital de la tontine initiée par les femmes de militaires dans le camp ; Plus tard, elle a reçu une petite commission issue d’une vente de parcelle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 sacs de pomme de terre à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Matiko, is the leader of the group "Amkeni". She is an entrepreneur, 57 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, all in school and some already with their own homes. Matiko sells potatoes. Her husband is a former soldier who is now retired. 

Matiko sets up her merchandise at the Virunga central market. In addition, she sells cell phone minutes out of her home. For fifteen years, she has been working at small revenue-generating businesses of these types. However, she got her initial capital from a tontine started by the wives of soldiers in the camp. Later on, she received a small commission from the sale of a plot of land.

This new loan must server to supply her with 4 sacks of potatoes to sell. Her ambition is to educated her children and to build a house for them. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are not eligible for banks.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes to sell

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr: Agé de 48 ans, Pascal est marié et père de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 6 ans. Spécialisé dans la vente des boissons depuis quelques années, il s'approvisionne dans les dépôts de SOBEBRA de la place. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, il a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de supporter les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Pascal, aged 48, is a married father of three children, who are in school. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 6. Specialized in selling beverages for a few years, Pascal gets his supplies from a local SOBEBRA outlet. With the goal of bolstering his sales and satisfying the strong demand from his ever-growing customer base, he requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. This loan will enable him to cover his children's schooling costs and family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 25 cases of beverages of all types and 10 pallets of drinks in plastic

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is from the village of Sillawit and is happily married to Alexander. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children.

Venus found it hard to find job, so she decided to open a sari-sari, or general store. She has been in business for almost five months and earns about 300 PHP a day. She would like, however, to have more stock on hand to sell.

In this regard, Venus is applying for a 7,000 loan from ASKI to buy noodles, bread, cookies, candies and condiments to sell. She believes that with this loan she will be able to improve her store as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bread, cookies, candies and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Ms Jameela is an active 47-year- old woman. She has been running a small general store at her home for many years. She deals with many clients on a daily basis. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She sells daily use goods such as biscuits, tea, grains etc. She is bound to provide her children with food every day as her husband is working in a factory and earning a very minimum wage. In this way, Jameela and her husband both are working hard to fulfill their children's needs. She wants to grow her business by adding more items to her store. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more grocery items like sugar and grains in bulk to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that she will earn more profits and intends to use the earned revenue on her children’s well-being. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items like sugar and grains in bulk

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Le gusta ser parte de su Banco Comunal ya que en ella aprendió a ser emprendedora y lo más importarte sabe invertir de manera adecuada el dinero. Esta agradecida con la institución por que le brindan facilidades de préstamos.
Abigail con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir exclusivamente en la compra de maderas de diferentes calidades.
El sueño de Abigail es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Abigail makes a living purchasing and selling wood.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank, since it has taught her to be enterprising and, most importantly, how to invest money properly.  She is grateful to the lending institution for the terms of its loans.   

Abigail is asking for a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of different qualities of wood.

Abigail’s dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase different qualities of wood.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 38 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 16 years. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mahutin Mathilde's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Mahutin Mathilde la responsable est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vend des tomates depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, Mahutin Mathilde a sollicité et a obtenu ensemble avec sa coéquipière un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de réaliser d'énormes profits afin de renforcer son stock de marchandise et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle envisage aider son mari à construire leur maison. Mahutin Mathilde se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Mahutin Mathilde, the group's official, is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Mahutin Mathilde has been selling tomatoes for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and from abroad.
 
With the goal of increasing her purchasing power and satisfying customer demands, Mahutin Mathilde and her teammate requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to make enormous profits, so as to bolster her stock of merchandise and help cover her children's schooling costs. She envisions helping her husband to build their house.  

Mahutin Mathilde is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Bénédicta Baï's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Bénédicta la responsable est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 20 ans et 08 ans. Elle vend des paquets de spaguetti, des boîtes de conserve, des savons, des oeufs et d'autres articles depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu ensemble avec sa coéquipière un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Bénédicta se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Bénédicta, the group's official, is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom the oldest and the youngest are 20 and 8 years old, respectively. Bénédicta has been selling packets of spaghetti, canned foods, soaps, eggs, and other goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 
 
Concerned about increasing her working capital and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, she and her teammate requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with the aim of maximizing her profits and helping to cover her children's schooling costs. 

Bénédicta is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase spaghetti, canned foods, soaps, and eggs for her store

loans.name: Delphine's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Delphine la responsable est âgée de 49 ans. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants scolarisés, elle a une boutique où elle vend des divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son capital et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, Delphine a sollicité et a obtenu ensemble avec sa coéquipière un appui financier à Finadev afin d'en tirer d'énorme profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Delphine se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Delphine, the group's official, is 49 years old, married, and the mother of two children, who are in school. She has a store where she has been selling a variety of goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin.
 
With the goal of bolstering her capital and meeting the needs of her customers, Delphine and her teammate requested and obtained financial support from Finadev with the aim of making enormous profits and helping to cover her children's schooling costs. 

Delphine is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase oil, soap, corn, and rice for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap to sell

loans.name: Precila

texts.es: A Prescila le gusta ser parte de Banco Comunal ya que en ella conoce amigas con las que comparte experiencias diferentes, como alegrías. Se dedica a la siembrar verduras y crianza de animales menores (cuyes, cerdo, carnero) para luego poder venderlas. Agradecida esta con la institución  por las facilidades de préstamo que ofrece. Las capacitaciones son muy interesantes, ya que con ellas saben como invertir de manera adecuada el dinero y practicar los valores. Prescila con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de animales, semillas de verduras y una parte para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Precila likes being part of the communal bank, since in it she has friends with whom she shares different experiences, as well as joys. Her work is planting vegetables and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep to sell. She is grateful to this institution for the convenience of the loans they offer. The training is very interesting, since with it they know how to appropriately invest their money and practice their values. With the new loan that she is applying for, Precila is going to invest in the purchase of animals and vegetable seeds and use part of it for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animals and seeds

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, 37, is a married woman with three children who lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She earns a living through a snack food vending business. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns 5000 PHP a month from this work. 

Estrella has applied for a loan of 17500 PHP from GDMPC to buy more snack foods to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Páula, quiere comprarse materia prima para el comedor, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le pueda ayudar a mejorar la disponibilidad de su cocina, se comprará carne, mariscos, pollo, frijoles, arroz, embutidos, que son algunos de los materiales que utiliza diariamente para elaborar los diferentes platillos.

Ella espera que esta nueva inversión le dé los resultados deseados, así como logró realizar la inversión con el préstamo anterior, ya que considera que fue muy exitosa y que está el momento le ha permitido subsistir con su familia cubriendo todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Páula wants to buy basic ingredients for her dining area. For this reason, she is applying for a loan that will help her improve the availability of her cuisine. She will buy meat, shellfish, chicken, beans, rice, and sausages, which are some of the ingredients that she uses daily to make her various dishes.

She hopes that this new investment will give her the desired results, just as she succeeded with the investment of her previous loan, which she considers very successful and which up until now has allowed her to maintain her family, covering all the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy meat, shellfish, chicken, beans, rice, and sausages

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes manages her cell phone accessories business and RTW stall. She has been running this type of business for more than five years. Her spouse is her helper in running their businesses.

Agnes is married and blessed with only one child who goes to school. She wants to obtain financial stability, educate her child and have a better way of living. At this time, she is struggling with a financial shortage due to some factors affecting the growth of her cell phone accessories business. One of the factors affecting her sales is the many competitors who provide quality service and customer satisfaction. In this situation, she has to find better ways to encourage customers to buy the products she offers. For this reason, Agnes decided to borrow additional working capital of PHP 15,000 to buy more cell phone accessories and new designs of RTW for her clothing sales business. She believes that she could be a better entrepreneur someday through continuous access to financial services from the lending institutions and adaptation of new marketing strategies.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories and different kinds of RTW clothing

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder invertir en el negocio comprándose un lote de medicamentos, entre ellos antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas, sueros, Este préstamo le permitirá volver a invertir en la estabilidad del negocio y poder salir a vender.
Con el préstamo anterior nos manifiesta que logró tener la oportunidad de invertir en medicamentos de calidad y de fácil acceso para los clientes, en su familia las circunstancias han sido mejores, teniendo una mejor condición a través de los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Victor is applying for a new loan to be able to invest in his business by buying a batch of medications, among them antibiotics, analgesics, vitamins, and serums. This loan will allow him to again invest in the stability of the business and to be able to go out to sell.

With his previous loan, he tells us that he had the opportunity to invest in medicines of good quality and easily accessible for his customers. Circumstances in his family have been better, with better conditions through financial income.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, analgesics, vitamins, and serums

loans.name: Carmen Aleyda

texts.es: Carmen de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida con su familia. Ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de pescado de diferentes clases. Las ventas las realizan en su casa, compra el pescado y lo revende a sus clientes que tiene en su aldea. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría y venta de cerdos. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar más pescado y vender. con el 30% del préstamo cancela deuda a una persona particular. Ha mantenido su negocio activo  y  quiere seguir creciendo y con las ganancias poder hacer apertura de una asociación de vendedores de pescado.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida with her family.

For the past six years, she has been selling different types of fish. Her sales are conducted at her house. She buys the fish and then sells her product to the customers in her neighborhood. Carmen has always been in the retail trade since she previous raised and sold pigs.

She is requesting her third loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The money will be spent on more fish to sell, but 30% of the loan amount will be used to pay back a personal debt. Carmen has maintained an active business, but she wants to continue growing and use her earnings to acquire a membership into an association of fish vendors.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell and to pay off a personal debt.

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru: Алимардон пришел в Арванд чтобы получить кредит на покупку корма для скота так как скоро зима и он должен запастись кормом.  Он  молодой отец  3 детей и любящий муж. Он разводит дома скот. У него большой дом и хозяйство.  Его родители поддерживают в развитии его хозяйства, они помогают выращивать овощи и разводить скот. Каждые 5-6 месяцев он выводит готовых коров на рынок для продажи.  Алимардон кроме откорма скота работает на стройке маляром. В его отсутствии его родители и жена ухаживают за скотом. Этот вид деятельности дает им очень хороший доход.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Alimardon has approached MDO Arvand for a loan to buy cattle feed because winter is coming and he needs to stock up. 

Alimardon is a loving husband and a young father of 3 children. He raises cattle at home, and has a large house and farm. His parents assist him with the farm work by growing vegetables and breeding cattle. Every 5-6 months, Alimardon takes the cows that are ready for sale to the market. Apart from raising cattle, Alimardon works in construction as a painter. When he is away, his parents and his wife take care of the cattle. This type of business gives them a good income. 

Alimardon thanks Arvand in advance for their support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro tiene 45 años, el se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, en la zona de Ejercito de Chaco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Pedro va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, el Sr. Pedro  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, El Sr. Pedro es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro, age 45, produces and sells bread. He has a bakery in his home, which is located in the District of Ejercito de Chaco.

This is his first loan with Emprender. Sr. Pedro will use this loan to buy flour in bulk for making a variety of breads. This will enable him to provide better service to his customers and increase his earnings. His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his business. Sr. Pedro will utilize these benefits so that he can keep buying utensils and supplies for producing his bread.

Sr. Pedro is a hardworking individual who is pleased with the opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas de marañón cruda, como una alternativa para darle continuidad al negocio, se comprara esta fruta ya que está un poco escasa y así  poder  mejorar su disponibilidad, espera hacer una buena compra.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior se le facilitaron las cosas, se compro semillas, esto le abrió las puertas con un record bueno en créditos, en su familia no ha atravesado ningún problema, su deseo es mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan in order to buy raw cashew nuts as a means of continuing her business. This will enable her to buy nuts since she has few resources. As a result, she will improve her available inventory and expect to obtain a good price.

María says that her previous loan helped her to accomplish many things, such as buying nuts and establishing the start of a good credit record. Her family has not experienced any problems. Her wish is to make gradual improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy raw cashew nuts.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, quiere surtir la tienda comprando más productos de consumo y también tiene el plan de iniciar una siembra de granos básicos, solicita este préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de huevos, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz, el abono y la semilla mejorada para realizar la siembra, Luis considera que aprovechará los recursos al máximo para hacer una buena inversión.

Él nos comenta que el efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior al negocio fue muy positivo, ya que surtió y agregó nuevos productos a la tienda, manifiesta tener una mejor condición en el negocio y su familia hasta el momento se ha mantenido bien, han logrado comprar de sus ganancias algunos artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Luis wants to restock his store by purchasing more consumer products, and also wants to start growing staple grains.  He is asking for this loan so he can purchase eggs, beans, oil, sugar, corn, fertilizer, and better seeds to plant.  Luis plans to make full use of his resources in order to make a good investment.

Luis says that his previous loan had a very positive effect on his business, since he was able to restock his store and add new products.  He also says that his business and his family’s situation have improved so far, and that he has been able to use his earnings to purchase some household items.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, beans, oil, sugar, corn, fertilizer, and better seeds.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma; tiene su taller de corte y confección, a ella le gusta las charlas que le dan en su Banco Comunal y reunirse con sus compañeras, donde le inculcan muchos valores como la puntualidad, la responsabilidad, el ahorro, de esa manera ha podido progresar.
El sueño de Irma es lograr sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma has her business producing clothing. She enjoys the talks that they have in her Communal Bank and getting together with her friends, where they instill many values such as punctuality, responsibility, and saving money. In this way, she has been able to make progress.

Irma’s dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.name: Joederick

texts.en:
Joederick is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. He usually earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season. Joederick is still single and lives with his parents in General Balao. He helps his family acquire income to cover their expenses. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 so he can give enough sustenance to his farm. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides used in the farming business.

Joederick is praying for his family's healthy lifestyle. He hopes to keep improving his income so he can save funds to use in times of emergencies. He dreams of having a wife and children someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Monica Adilene

texts.es:
Mónica, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intención de continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para dinamizar la mercadería, se comprará blusas de diferentes colores y estilos, camisetas, salta, pantalones, ropa interior, toda esta mercadería le ayudará para crear una mayor satisfacción de los clientes y mejorar las ventas.

Para Mónica la experiencia con el crédito anterior fue muy favorable, comenta que le permitió realizar una buena inversión en mercadería y poder trabajar con su familia, manifiesta que se mantienen estables hasta el momento no han enfrentado ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Monica has decided to request a new loan, with the intention to continue to invest in the business and keep the merchandise dynamic, she will buy different colors and styles of blouses, shirts, pants, underwear, all this merchandise will help her make her customers happier and increase sales.

For Monica, the experience of the previous loan was very good, she says it allowed her to make a good investment in merchandise and allowed her to work with her family, they are stable at the moment and haven't faced any inconveniences.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es: Paulina tiene un taller de carpintería. Le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que en ella se distrae y conoce amigas. Esta agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que ofrecen. Las capacitaciones son muy interesantes ya que ayudan tanto para el negocio y familias. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como madera, lacas, tiñer.
texts.en: Paulina has a carpentry shop.  She likes the Community Bank meetings because they are fun and she meets friends.  She is thankful with the institution for the credit terms offered.  The training sessions are very interesting because they help with the business and family.  The new loan requested will be invested in buying raw materials such as wood, lacquer, paint thinner.

loans.use: to buy wood, lacquer and paint thinner for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en:
Esmael is 42 years old. He has two children and is married to Elsie. He is a farmer who raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually trades the rice to traders in their village. He would like to nourish his crops so he can produce abundantly and gain a good income, but he has insufficient funds now. He is now asking for PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

With good funds, he will give the best education to his children, earn a degree and have better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald's main goal in life is to give a good education to his children and a fortunate life, too. He is 38 years old, married to a housewife and has three children attending school. He derives income from selling his harvested rice crops. He had been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years now. He usually earns PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year) and wants to increase it. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) for the rice farming business. 

Ronald hopes to keep nourishing his crops to harvest more, which will offer economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his rice farming business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a rice grower from General Balao, is very industrious. He plants and harvests rice twice a year to sell for a profit. This is the viable source of his income. He has already been married for almost four months and had no children yet. 

David is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for labor fees and fertilizers used in farming. This will help him continuously produce abundant crops from his one-hectare rice field and keep earning good funds for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio and his family live less fortunately but they are still happy. The couple has four children. His wife, Maria, vends vegetables for income.  He raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy five sacks of UREA (fertilizer) and pesticides used in farming. This will help maintain good sales from the business. 

Someday, Antonio would like to continously harvest productive output and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 24 years old. He is single. He has been a maize farmer for four years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at his previous maize ground, which he will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald tiene 26 años y es soltero, el se dedica a la venta  de comida en su puesto de venta se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la localidad de Puerto Rico. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Ronald va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar sus verduras y alimentos y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frízer. El Sr. Ronald enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ronald is 26, single and sells food at a stand located in one of the markets of the town of Puerto Rico (Bolivia).  This loan is his first credit with the institution, Ronald is going to use this loan to buy a freezer that he needs to keep his vegetables and food as well as to buy tables and provide more comfort to his customers, reason why he requests this loan is the need of capital to purchase these items.  Ronald faces challenges in his business such as grow his customer base.  He will use the profits to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and tables

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery. Estando en Finca logró educar a sus hijos y mantener el negocio al que se dedica. Las capacitaciones contienen mensajes motivadores para que así uno pueda seguir superándole. Dolores invertirá su nuevo préstamo en la compra de frutas al por mayor.
texts.en: Dolores sells fruits at retail and wholesale at the Nery market.  While living in Finca she was able to raise her children and maintain the business that she works on.  The bank training sessions have motivational messages for one to get ahead.  Dolores will invest the new loan in buying wholesale fruits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 53 años que está casado con María 54, el alcanzó a cursar estudios primarios y viven en Otavalo un cantón de la provincia de Imbabura, una provincia que se encuentra al norte de la República del Ecuador en donde su mayoría de habitantes son indígenas y es el pueblo más rico en todo el país donde se fabrican gran cantidad de artesanías que son exportadas y son muy cotizadas internacionalmente. El turismo es una fuente muy importante de ingresos ya que es visitada por personas nacionales e internacionales por sus atractivos centros turísticos en la ciudad como sus arquitectónicas calles y cascadas y ríos fuera de la ciudad. Las fiestas que se realizan allí y su gastronomía son muy concurridas, pues son típicas de la raza indígena en donde son bienvenidos visitantes de todo el país y el mundo.
José se dedica a cultivar frutillas para luego comercializarlas, lleva realizando esta actividad 6 años e invierte hasta 12 horas cada día. Aprendió de este negocio de una Asociación de trabajadores que realizan el mismo trabajo con otras frutas y cultivos y José pertenece a esta Asociación. Él solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa para incrementar sus cultivos para lo cual necesita insumos como plásticos, abono orgánico y químico y otros, con este incremento sus ingresos serán mayores y con esto podrá brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose is a 53-year-old man married to Maria, 54, he finished elementary school and lives in Otavalo in a house in the province of Imbabura, located in the North of Ecuador, where most if its inhabitants are indigenous people and is a rich town in the country where a large amount of crafts are made and exported and have international demand.
Tourism is an important source of income because they are visited by nationals and foreigners due to it's attractive touristic centers in the city such as the architectural streets and waterfalls and rivers that are outside the city.  The celebrations and gastronomy are very popular, because they are traditional of their people where visitors from around the world are welcome.
Jose grows strawberry to sell, he has worked in this activity for six years and spends up to 12 hours on it per day.  He learned this business from the workers association that performs the same activity with other fruits and crops, Jose belongs to this association.  He requested a loan to Fundacion Alternativa to increase his planted land for which he needs products such as plastic, organic fertilizer, chemicals and others, with this expansion his income will be higher and he'll be able to provide a better lifestyle to his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 34 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs in the production of maize.

loans.name: Les Rayons De Borddermere1, 3, 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Bertheleine est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Les Rayons de Borddemere. Elle es une commercante. Elle habite dans la région  Bord-de-Mere  d’Haïti  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Bertheleine a dirigé son  commerce de Produit Divers   pendant 10 années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce Bertheleine était un couturiere. elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers. Elle  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business de  Produit Alimentaire. Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  Charbon, Vetement, chaussures, entre autre.

Bertheleine dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un  gros business avec son  fond et par la  grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bertheleine is the coordinator of her group "Les Rayons de Borddemere".  She works in retail business and lives in the Bord-de-Mere region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  Bertheleine has been managing her business (she sells various goods) for the past ten years.

Prior to working in retail business, Bertheleine used to be a seamstress. She would like to use her loan to invest in the purchase of various goods. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her retail food business.  Other members of the group need a loan to finance such activities as the sale of charcoal, clothes, shoes etc.

Bertheleine says that her main challenge is  to become an important seller.  She also says that her main goal and dream is to own a large business.  She plans to reach her goal using her own funds and with the help of God.

loans.use: to buy various food products.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie, a 54-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband, has a working child and one sibling. She, together with her husband, manages the family’s expenses without forgetting the big support of their child. Marie has been working as a housekeeper for many years. She visits her customers at their places. She also works in the same occupation at a local bank on her free time. As for her husband, he owns a garage, where he works as a car electrician. Marie keeps on working very hard in order to bring added income to her family. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new cleaning machinery for her business. She wishes to increase her revenue and feels the loan will definitely help her achieve her goals. In the near future, Marie wishes to collect money and take a rest, especially after getting older.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning machinery for her business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, age 51, is married and has four children. He lives with his family in a community in the Mombasa municipality in Kenya. Said has a grocery store in his home. In his business he sells products for family consumption, like basic foods (corn, rice, and beans), dairy products, commonly used medicines, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products. In addition to this, he has a water-selling business selling to the community.

He has currently requested a loan for 50,000 KES. He plans on using the loan to better stock commodities like balers of maize and wheat flour, rice, etc. He hopes that his sales will grow as he devotes about 12 hours a day tending to his clientele.

loans.use: to buy balers of maize, wheat flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is 47 years old, married and had one child working abroad already. He is a rice grower, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He gains about PHP 10,000 each harvest season, and he still aims to increase his income. He is now borrowing a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) used in the farming business. With continuous effort and determination in the business, Florencio hopes to keep acquiring productive income from the small farming business.

In the future, Florencio would like to give a fortunate life to his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) used in the farming business.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is 36 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes, porkbuns, etc.,  in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy goods and equipment. In the future, Fetu hopes to continue her business to earn more money to help her family income. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda, yeast, milk, eggs, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a brave man. He’s 56 year old and married to an adorable and lovely woman. They have two children who work and live in their own house that is located in a one of the wonderful Lebanese villages. Nabil is the main provider of income for his family. He has huge responsibilities to care for, which is why he asks sometimes for his children’s support. In 2006, Nabil started to work on his own taxi. His job consists of transporting people to and from their places upon request. 

And because Nabil is facing some problems with his car, he has requested to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on it in addition of paying the mechanic fees. This is how Nabil works to better develop his business. He really wishes to expand his work and buy a van to transport a wider range of clients.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi in addition to paying the mechanic fees.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, necesita solicitar un nuevo préstamo, ya que está iniciando su labor en la agricultura sembrando lo que es maíz y frijol, ella necesita comprarse abono, herbicidas, tratamiento para las hormigas, ya que esto le impide que su cultivo crezca, ella espera de la inversión obtener los resultados más mejores
el efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue una buena producción y que sus ingresos aumentaran por las ventas de la cosecha, con estas ganancias ha logrado ayudar a sus hijos en los gastos que se le representan, está muy agradecida por los financiamientos a través de kiva.
texts.en: Magdalena must request a new loan because so she can begin her farm activity planting maize and beans.  She needs to buy compost, herbicides and treatment for the ants which keep her crops from growing.  She hopes through the investment to obtain better results.  The effect of her first loan was that production was good and her income increased through sales at harvest time.  With the profits earned she has been able to cover her children's expenses.  She is grateful for the loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy compost, herbicides, and ant treatment.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Hola  me llamo Oscar, vivo en Costa Rica , soy agricultor, además soy una persona muy emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, voy a comprar semilla para cultivar maíz y frijol, en el proceso de desarrollo  necesito darle mantenimiento con fungicidas, e insecticidas y abonos, y es para la compra de estos suministros y de las semillas que estoy solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), aquí en el sector sur del país donde yo vivo la mayoría somos agricultores por lo cual dependemos de esta actividad para sostener a nuestras familias, en mi caso a mi esposa y a mi pequeña hija, con su ayuda y por medio de este proyecto se que saldré adelante. Esta es mi oportunidad de crédito accesible y de cuotas manejables de acuerdo a nuestros ingresos.
texts.en: Hi, my name is Oscar and I live in Costa Rica.  I am a farmer and very enterprising person with a great desire for improving my lifestyle.  I plant to buy seeds to plant maize and beans; and in the development process I need to provide maintenance through fungicides, insecticides and fertilizers.  To buy these supplies and the seeds, I am requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 CRC.  Here in the southern part of the country where I live, most of us are farmers and depend on this activity to support our families, which in my case includes my wife and small daughter.  With your help and through this project, I hope to be able to get ahead.  This is my opportunity to obtain a loan with manageable payment terms in accordance with our income.

loans.use: To buy maize and bean seeds, as well as farm supplies.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Mi nombre es Nidia vivo en la parte sur de Costa Rica, soy casada y tengo dos hijos que están cursando la educación  secundaria.  Durante varios años me he dedicado a la agricultura,  específicamente a la siembra de maíz , con esta actividad ayudo a mi esposo con las cargas económicas del hogar . Necesito un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para comprar insecticidas, fungicidas y abonos para darle asistencia al cultivo durante todo el período de desarrollo, mi deseo es que entre mi esposo y yo podamos darle un  ejemplo de esfuerzo y de trabajo a nuestros hijos, gracias por esta oportunidad de crédito .
texts.en: My name is Nidia and I live in the southern part of Costa Rica.  I am married and have two children in middle school.  For several years I have been involved in farming, specifically growing maize.  Through this activity I help my husband cover household expenses.  I am requesting a loan in the amount of 1,035,000 CRC to buy insecticides, fungicides and fertilizer to help my crops during the growing stage.  My hope is that my husband and I can serve as examples of effort and hard work for our children.  Thank you for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Fortaleza”, se encuentra en el  Cuarto Ciclo con 19 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
La Directora es la Sra.  Ramona quien fue elegida por las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles.
