The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod is 47 years old. He lives in a house which is in bad condition. His wife, who stays at home, is a kind woman. They have three clever children.  Murod must finish the building of new house as he began some years ago. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy building materials to continue building the new house. In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and stability, which will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy. Please help him and his family if possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement, to build a new house.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: Ademar,es un agricultor, casado, padre de 8 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Puntarenas, Costa Rica, se dedica a la siembra de café, cuando recoge la cosecha la  vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad . Ademar necesita aumentar la producción de café para ello solicita seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas) e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su siembra . Su numerosa familia colabora en todo el proceso desde la siembra hasta la recolección, los gastos familiares son muy grandes, por lo que cada uno pone todo su esfuerzo para ayudar a su padre en esta actividad, cada año don Ademar siembra nuevas plantas para que su cafetal se valla renovando . Dice haber encontrado una gran oportunidad de crecimiento y un medio de obtener crédito accesible a personas que como él necesitan este tipo de ayuda financiera.
texts.en:
Ademar is a farmer who is married and the father of 8 children. He lives in the city of Puntarernas, Costa Rica. Ademar cultivates coffee trees and after gathering the harvest, he sells the beans in his community's collection centers.

Ademar needs to augment coffee production. That's why he is borrowing 600,000 colons, to buy small coffee plants and inputs so that he can maintain his plantings. 

Each member of his numerous family collaborates in the entire process, from sowing to harvesting. Family expenses are very large, and as a result, all the members devote all their efforts to helping their father in this activity. Each year, Ademar sows new plants so that his coffee grove will be renewed. He feels he has found a grand opportunity for growth and a means of obtaining accessible credit for persons like him who need this type of financial aid.

loans.use: buy small coffee plants and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett is 33 years old and single.  She lives Payatas, Philippines.  She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Janett operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Janett is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Janett hopes that her business will expand and have more customers who will patronize her food stall. 

Janett faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

Ingredients

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in the carpentry business in Nakuru town for the last three years.  He is 45 years old, married to Pamela, and they have two children, aged 14 years and 3 years.

Stephen has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more timber to use in his carpentry shop. He will then be able to meet the demands of his clients. 

In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his business and supply furniture to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to  buy timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is happy that she is now married and has a young child who is a source of joy in her marriage. She used her previous loan to invest in her clothes-selling business. Now, she has a beauty salon which is doing well. She offers her customers hairstyling, haircuts, hair color, nail treatments, etc. She also sells products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, etc. She has the business in her small area, and she is very well-known in the neighborhood.

She will use the requested loan to buy beauty products to use in the salon and to sell. Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get her family ahead and to be able to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 41, is a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jonald, a family driver, and they have five children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the entire working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (cooked food) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sahr H.'s Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers from the Eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have requested for a loan 8,800,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf. Bernadette is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono, 51 years ago, Bernadette has been in the teaching profession for 28 years now. She is single with five children, three in primary school and two in secondary school. She has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for her children and also to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and also to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30 years old and married.  To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been in the business for over five years. Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management, she has improved her business.  She has also learned how to save her money.

Jane has requested KES 20,000 to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 23 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for his maize fields. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at the previous maize field, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La socia es la señora Elena, ahora con 58 años de edad, ella continúa con su actividad económica de confección y venta de ropa de lana para damas, caballeros y niños, y los comercializa de forma directa a sus clientes y a solicitud. Elena en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar actividad y comprar diferentes tipos y colores de fibras de lanas, accesorios e hilos. Elena está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en la educación del menor de sus hijos que esta estudiando en la universidad. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Elena, who is now 58-years-old, continues with her economic activity which is making wool clothing for women, men and children to sell.  She sells directly to her customers and to order.  On this occasion, Elena is requesting a loan to capitalize her activity and buy various types of wool yarn in assorted colors, accessories and thread.  

Elena is very grateful for Kiva’s help because it helped her strengthen her economic activity that allows her to provide better quality of life for her family and with her youngest son’s education; he’s attending university.  She is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy various types of wool yarn in assorted colors, accessories and thread.

loans.name: Abedal-Rahman

texts.en:
Abedal-Rahman, who appears in the picture, is a 34-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and two daughters. He is a construction worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Abedal-Rahman has been working in the construction supplies business, supplying construction workshops with wood and iron. This has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs. Abedal-Rahman is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more construction supplies of wood and iron. This will improve his work quality and increase demand from his customers. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more construction supplies of wood and iron

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy, 50, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Godofredo and a mother to her children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Remy hopes to give her children a good and high quality education, and she dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Nery Reyna

texts.es: Nery es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 12 años. Tiene 36 años es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Estando en Finca logrÓ comprar su terreno. Actualmente Nery tiene un recreo en un local alquilado. Comenta que se supero por que aprendió a invertir de manera adecuada el dinero. Las capacitaciones son muy interesantes ya que motivan a seguir emprendiendo. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en el acabado de su casa. El sueño que tiene Nery es comprar un carro y formar su empresa de transportes.
texts.en: Nery has been a member of FINCA Perú for 12 years.  She’s 36-years-old, married and the mother of three children.  Being in FINCA Perú she succeeded in buying a piece of land.  She currently leases a snack bar.  She comments that she improved because she learned how to invest her money properly.  The training sessions are very interesting because they motivate her to continue being an entrepreneur.  She will use the new loan she’s requesting to do some home improvements.  Nery’s dream is to buy a car and set up a transportation firm.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Nora Concepcion

texts.es: Nora, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Nora tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, hace tres años inicio un negocio en su casa donde vende variedad de comidas y como otros ingresos confecciona cortinas y sabanas. El negocio de comidas lo atiende el fin de semana, vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella ha obtenido cuatro préstamos con ODEF lo que le ha permitido mantener estable su negocio. El préstamo actual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas como harina, manteca, carnes, lácteos, condimentos, etc. y compra de utensilios de cocina. Espera que su negocio sea más rentable y poder seguir trabajando. Su meta es trabajar duro para lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Nora, 37, is married and has a son; she lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  Nora has her own source of income.  Three years ago she started a home-based business selling food and as an additional source of income she makes curtains and sheets.  The food business is on weekends; she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner.  

She’s had four ODEF loans that have helped her to keep her business stable.  She will use her current 22,000 Lempira loan to buy ingredients like flour, lard, meat, dairy products, condiments, etc. needed to prepare her meals; she will also buy kitchen utensils.  She hopes her business will be more profitable and to be able to stay in business.  Her goal is to work hard to have a better standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Jose Ramón, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Don Jose se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas y hace un año decidió realizar el cultivo de chile picante, ya que tiene buena demanda. Anteriormente vendía mariscos. la producción de chile la vende en el mercado local y nacional. El ha obtenido el apoyo financiero de ODEF en varios ciclos, actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar una maquina de chapear o deshierbar el cultivo  de chile picante. Con esta herramienta va ahorrar pago de mano de obra y tiempo y dará mejor mantenimiento. El tiene como meta lograr la compra de un terreno propio para sus cultivos ya que donde cultiva actualmente es alquilado.
texts.en:
José Ramón, 39, is married and has four children; he lives with his family in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  José works in agriculture and a year ago decided to start growing hot chili peppers because they are in high demand.  He used to sell seafood.  He sells his chili peppers in the local and the national market.  

He’s had several cycles of ODEF support and he’s now asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy a weeder for his hot chili pepper crops.  With this tool he will save on labor costs and time and will provide better crop care.  His goal is to buy his own farmland because the land he currently farms is leased.

loans.use: to buy a weeder for his hot chili pepper crops.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 34 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. She will use her Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken on the previous maize field, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cover the cost of labor in maize production

loans.name: Claudia Gloribel

texts.es: Claudia de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella ha establecido su propio negocio en su casa desde hace mas de tres años, donde vende variedad de comida como ser: pollo frito con tajadas, Chuleta frita, almuerzos, baleadas (tortillas de harina rellenas con frijoles, queso, huevo etc.) y refrescos. Atiende este negocio todos los días de lunes a sábado. Es un negocio rentable ya que tiene su clientela fija. y lo ha mantenido estable y surtido mediante préstamos que ODEF ha otorgado. El préstamo actual que solicita es el número ocho y es por 28,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más insumos (harina, carnes, granos básicos, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, etc.) que utiliza para la elaboración de comidas, con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas y tener siempre los insumos a la disposición. Tiene planes de ampliar el negocio y obtener más ingresos para un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Claudia, 43, is married and has four children; she lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. She’s had a home-based business for three years where she sells food like fried chicken with fried plantain slices, fried chops, lunches, ‘baleadas’ (flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese, egg, etc.) and soft-drinks.  She works every day from Monday through Saturday.  It’s a profitable business that already has a regular clientele.  She’s kept it stable and well-stocked thanks to the loans ODEF has granted her.  The current loan is her 8th and it’s for 28,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy ingredients (flour, meat, basic grains, lard, condiments, soft-drinks, etc.) that she uses to prepare her meals.  Her goal is to increase sales and to always have ingredients on hand.  She plans to expand the business and earn more income to have a better standard of living

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Goberlinda

texts.es: Rosa es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 7 años. Tiene 52 años es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Rosa tiene una tienda donde vende mochilas. Esta muy contenta porque aprendió a ahorrar. Las capacitaciones son de su agrado y le parecen muy interesantes y bonitas ya que le ayudan mucho tanto en el negocio, como en su vida familiar. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of FINCA Perú for seven years. She is 52 years old, married, and mother of three children. Rosa has a store where she sells backpacks. She is very happy because she learned how to save. She likes the trainings and she thinks they are interesting and good, because they help her a lot in her business and in her family life.

The new loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a lot.

loans.use: to buy a lot.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 46-year-old active, married woman.  She has been doing excellent work of hand embroidery at her home for the last 5 years. She has exceptional skills for doing it. She has gotten a lot of admiration from her community members. The demand for her collection is increasing day by day. She is contributing to the family income. Her husband is employed in a small shop repairing bicycles and one of her son operates a food cart. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of thread and sequins in different colors to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery designs as her customer base is varied and diverse.  She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of thread and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 46, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a carpenter, and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor y menor. Ella se siente agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de los préstamos que ofrece. Comenta que las capacitaciones son muy interesantes. Modesta con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor y una parte para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Modesta sells fruit at wholesale and retail.  She feels very grateful to the institution for the ease with which it grants loans.  She comments that the training sessions are very interesting.    Modesta will use the new loan she’s requesting to buy fruit at wholesale;  part of the loan will be used for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jose Abad

texts.es: Jose, tiene 57 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Tela. Don Jose tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la ganadería, el tiene un terreno grande donde mantiene las vacas productoras de  leche, la producción de leche la vende en el mercado local. También don Jose inicio otro negocio en su casa hace aproximadamente cuatro meses de venta de golosinas como ser: refrescos, churros, variedad de dulces, topogigios (helados de leche o sabor a fruta). En busca de generar otros ingresos decidió solicitar un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de golosinas que tiene en su casa. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener más ingresos y poderle ayudar más a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
José, 57, is married and has four children; he lives in Tela.  He’s been a cattleman for 20 years; he has a large piece of land where he keeps dairy cows.  He sells the milk in the local market.  

José has also started a new business at home about four months ago selling snacks like soft-drinks, packaged snacks, assorted candy, topogigios (milk or fruit based frozen treats).  

Seeking to earn additional income, he decided to request a 5,000 Lempira loan to stock the snack shop he has at home.  His plant is to make the business grow to earn more income and be able to help his children more with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft-drinks, cookies and candy to stock his new business.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo, es casado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en secundaria, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Gonzalo estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria, actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas al día elaborando calzados de mujer para posteriormente venderlos de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material como ser cuero, clefa, cierres, plantillas,  etc., para la elaboración de más de sus productos, de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos.
El sueño de Gonzalo, es construir más habitaciones en su vivienda y dar más comodidad a su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gonzalo’s married and has two children attending secondary school.   He lives in his two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.

Gonzalo completed secondary school and currently works more than ten hours daily manufacturing women’s shoes to then sell from place to place since he does not have a permanent stand.

He needs the loan to buy materials like leather, glue, zippers, insoles, etc. needed to make his items; he will improve his income this way.

Gonzalo’s dream is to add more rooms to his house to provide more comfort for his family.  This is his fifth loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos de la venta de pollo a la broaster trabajando por más de ocho horas al día junto a su esposo ya que deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, azulejos y pintura para la refacción de su cocina ya que desea tener más comodidad para la elaboración de sus productos.
El sueño de Silvia, es ampliar su negocio para percibir mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvia’s married and has two school age children.  She lives in her own two-bedroom house located in the city of El Alto’s Mariscal Sucre zone.

She earns income at present selling Broasted chickens; she works more than 8 hours daily with her husband since they must cover their family’s food, education and basic utility expenses.

She needs the loan to buy stucco, tile and paint to redo her kitchen because she wants to make her products more comfortably.  Silvia’s dream is to expand her business so that she can earn higher income and improve her quality of life.  This is her second loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old young man. He is married and the father of one son and one daughter.

For the past four years, Mohammad has been working in agriculture. He has a greenhouse where he plants different types of vegetables, which has been a profitable project, and the only source of income for the family, but he also needs more support to cover the cost. He is requesting a 1,500-USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing agricultural fertilizers. It will allow Mohammad to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Mohammad is photographed inside the greenhouse he has.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg, 52, is a cook in a restaurant in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for 11 years nonstop. She lives with her family in the ger district of Mongolian nomadic yurts and houses in the boundary of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She wanted to repair her house. In winter, her house becomes cold and has a heat loss through some parts of the house. The walls and door have been damaged too much and became very bad. She is planning to make the wall insulation by foam, sand and cement and replace the new wooden door. She totally believes that her family can live in comfort and stay warm at home in winter after the repair. She is requesting a loan to buy the building materials including metal board roof, wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.use: To buy the building materials including metal board roof, wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha, who is 42 years old, is a married woman with nine children and lives in the outskirts of Mombasa.

She decided to start her own source of income seven years ago. She sells fish at the market.  She asked Yehu for a previous loan to keep her business stocked. This business is her source of income to cover household expenses.

She’s currently asking for her second loan of KES 30,000 to buy more fish.   Her goal is to continue growing to obtain better profits.  And, with help from her husband, she wants to build her own house, since the family is currently residing in a rental house.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 29-year-old young man.  He is married and a father to one son.

For the past three years, Omar has had a mobile phone store, which has been profitable and the only source of income to him.

Omar is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and accessories. This will attract more customers to choose and buy what they like and allow Omar to expand the scope of his work.  That will improve his business and increase the family's income.

Omar is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: EL SR. FAUSTO ES UN HOMBRE MAYOR, TIENE 66 AÑOS DE EDAD Y ESTA CASADO CON LA SRA. EDUARDA. DON FAUSTO RECIBE UNA PENSION MENSUAL CON LA CUAL CUBRE LOS GASTOS DE SU CASA Y SU FAMILIA. EL ES UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR QUE SIEMPRE SE HA ESFORZADO POR DARLE LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA Y CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES. ADEMAS DE SU PENSION DON FAUSTO TRABAJA EN UN CENTRO COMERCIAL COMO EMPACADOR Y RECIBE UN INGRESO EXTRA DE LAS PROPINAS QUE LOS CLIENTES LE DAN. GRACIAS A ESTE TRABAJO Y LA PENSION QUE RECIBE, FAUSTO HA CUBIERTO LOS GASTOS DE EL Y SU FAMILIA. PERO EL TIENE EL DESEO DE PODER REALIZAR UNA MEJORA EN SU CASA. QUIERE TERMINAR UNA BARDA LATERAL DE SU CASA PARA PODER MANTENER LA PRIVACIDAD DE SU FAMILIA Y TENER SEGURA SU VIVIENDA. POR ESTE MOTIVO EL SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA REALIZAR ESTE PROYECTO EN SU CASA.
texts.en: Mr. Fausto is an elderly man. He is 66 years old and married to Mrs. Eduarda. Don Fausto receives a monthly pension that he uses to cover the expenses of the home. He is a hard-working man who has always tried to provide the best for his family and provide for their needs. In addition to his pension he works at a mall as a packer and receives some extra money from the tips the customers give him. Thanks to his work and his pension, Fausto has provided for his and his family's expenses but he desires to make an improvement to his house. He wants to finish the side wall of his house to maintain his family's privacy and provide greater security in his dwelling. For this reason he is asking for a loan to complete the project at his home.

loans.use: To finish the wall of his house.

loans.name: Geovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, es casada y tiene dos hijos que atienden a la secundaría, viven en una casa en anticrético ocupando una habitación; la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de diez horas en su taller de chapería (lugar donde se arreglan autos chocados),  junto a  su esposo, realizando todo tipo de trabajos con vehículos y con lo que ganan deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material para su taller de chapería ya que necesita lijas, pintura y otros, para continuar con su trabajo y aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Giovanna es comprarse una casa para tener más comodidad y seguridad también desea ampliar su taller.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Giovanna’s married and has two children attending secondary school.  She lives in an ‘anticrétco’ one-bedroom house [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.

She earns income at present working more than ten hours daily in her auto body shop (a place where wrecked cars are repaired) with her husband doing all sorts of jobs on vehicles.  They use what they earn to cover food, school and basic utility costs for the family.

She needs the loan to buy materials for her auto body shop because she needs sandpaper, paint and others to continue working and increasing income.  Giovanna’s dream is to buy a house to have more comfort and security and she also wants to expand the shop.  This is the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sandpaper and paint for her auto body shop.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 48 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken on the previous maize field, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and cover labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Hanan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Hanan is a 29-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She has two children. She requested a 600-JOD loan to pay for her home improvements and painting. In the future she would like to buy some furniture and buy a house for her family. Since Hanan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Buyanjargal

texts.en: Buyanjargal, 34, is a mechanic and he works in the mining company in Mongolia. Since 2009 he has been doing his job and initially he started his career as a repairman. He lives with his wife and his daughter in the ger district, where there are Mongolian traditional yurts and houses in the boundary of the city. He is asking for a loan to make some repairs to his old and bad house. At first he is planning to rebuild his coal-fired furnace which suffers from too much smoke in the air. Then he will add wall insulation to his thin walls which have a heat loss in winter time. He thinks that his home will be warmer and more comfortable after the repairs.

loans.use: To make some repairs to his old and bad house.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 7,000,000 to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Mohamed, pictured at right, is the leader of this group of teachers. Mohamed was born in the village of Segbwema, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is 55 years old and married to a trader. Mohamed has eight children, six of whom are attending secondary schools. Mohamed has been a teacher for 36 years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like paint, iron corrugated zinc, boards, etc., for the completion of the dwelling house he has begun building.

loans.use: to buy building materials like paint, iron corrugated zincs, boards, etc., to complete his house.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
This is Milagrosa, 34 years old and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Renante, a security guard, and is mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagrosa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Milagrosa hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
Sokeng is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

The main source of family’s income is from growing cassava on two hectares of farmland.  She has been in this business for four years, and she can earn about KHR 16,000 per day from the current business and manages to save about KHR 6,000 each day after deducting daily expenses.

Sokeng is a first-cycle loan client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other member of her group is a third-time borrower. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava business. She hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and timely so as to sell it for a good price in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is a farmer living in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 38 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and go to school. She has been growing cassava for fifteen years and supplementing the income by working in a rubber field for a fee while her husband is a teacher in the local village. From the current business, she can earn about 80,000 KHR per day.

This is Eng’s first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan with VisionFund of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her cassava planting and use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes this purchase will boost her crop production and reduce the loss due to pests, so she can make more income. By doing so, she can improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava planting

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nasser appears in her Kiva profile photo.  The photo was taken in his grocery store.

Nada is a 30-year-old young woman.  She is married and mother to three sons and two daughters.  Her husband is employed but gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Nada's husband has had a store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to generate working capital. 

Nada is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stocks of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, canned food, and dairy products. This will increase sales and increase the family's income, and that will ensure to them better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María se decida a la venta de pescado y leña. Esta agradecida con Finca por el apoyo que le brinda, ya que gracias a Finca pudo mejorar en su negocio y brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Asimismo agradece por la capacitaciones que recibe en sus reuniones de su Bancomunal, porque le enseñan a ser responsable, educación de sus hijos, como llevar su negocio y a ahorrar,y con ellos pudo mejora en su hogar. El préstamo que solicitá lo invertirá en la compra de sus productos como pescado y leña para su negocio.
texts.en: María works selling fish and firewood. She is thankful to Finca for the support they provide her. Thanks to Finca, she was able to improve her business and give her children a better education. She is also thankful for the training she receives in the meetings of her community bank because the teach her to be responsible, how to educate her children, and run a business and to save money. The loans have enabled her to improve her home. She will use the loan to buy products for her business like fish and firewood.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Buscando Progreso De Las Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Buscando Progreso Para  Las Mujeres”, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora  de una de las miembros, se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con  once integrantes.  El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes ya cuentan con sus actividades productivas.
Una de las integrantes es Melania, quien se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas, con lo cual se gana la vida y el sustento de su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo honesta, que se destaca por la gran labor que hace dentro del grupo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de almidón, maneca, anís, queso, huevo y demás, para seguir haciendo las chipas que vende y así seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Buscando Progreso Para Las Mujeres” (Seeking Advancement for Women) was created under the initiative of one of its members. It is on its first loan cycle and is made up of 11 members. The starting of this bank is proof of the union and solidarity of its members, all of which now have an income-generating activity. 
Melania is one such member. She makes and sells chipas, a kind of cheese buns made with cassava starch. This is her livelihood and her family's source of income. She is hard-working and above all, an honest woman that stands out because of the important support she gives to her bank.
Melania is asking for this loan in order to purchase starch, animal fat, aniseed, cheese, eggs and other ingredients necessary to make chipas and thus, to generate an income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase starch, animal fat, aniseed, cheese, eggs and other ingredients

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia se dedica a la venta de pescado, carne y queso los cuales lleva a la selva. Desde que esta en FINCA logró mejorar en su negocio, su capital y su mercadería, le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe por su promotora porque aprende muchas cosas buenas que pone en practica en su negocio y en su familia. Ella solicita un  préstamo para la compra de sus productos como carne, pescado, queso.
texts.en: Emilia sells fish, meat and cheese; she takes them to the jungle.  Since she’s been in FINCA she’s managed to improve her business, her capital and her merchandise.  She likes the training she gets from her advisor because she learns many good things that she puts into practice both in her business and at home.  She’s requesting a loan to buy products like meat, fish and cheese.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish and cheese.

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es: Edwin, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula. Edwin tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de reparación de aparatos eléctricos y de refrigeración como ser: aire acondicionado, refrigeradoras, lavadoras, secadoras, etc. y luego los vende. Para seguir manteniendo estable su negocio está solicitando un préstamo de 21,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar repuestos y aparatos de refrigeración para vender. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo en el negocio, crecer con su clientela y en lo personal ser un ejemplo para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 37, is married and has a son; he lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.  Edwin has been working in his own business for over five years repairing appliances and air conditioning equipment like air conditioners, refrigerators, washing machines, clothes dryers, etc. that he then resells.

In order to stay in business he’s requesting a 21,000 Lempira loan to buy spare parts and air conditioning equipment to sell.  His goal is to continue growing in his business, to expand his clientele and on a personal level to be an example for his family.

loans.use: to buy broken appliances and air conditioning equipment as well as spare parts for them.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 36 años, en un hombre trabajador; vive en su propia casa, junto a su pareja Norma de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos. La actividad que realiza Daniel, es a labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de  café, cacao y estebia; esta actividad realiza durante 25 años. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con la ayuda de jornaleros, de esa manera llega a extraer rápido sus frutos para luego llevarla a vender a los centros de acopio. Lo que considera difícil el no poder eliminar a las plagas que afectan sus frutales: ya que de esa forma no puede lograr a conseguir buena producción. Por lo tanto acude a MFP, para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo y así no perjudique su producción. Este es su crédito número 07, se siente contento por la confianza y por ende se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirles trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para que las plagas no afecten sus frutales.
texts.en:
Daniel, 36, is a hardworking man living in his own house with his spouse, Norma, 35, and their three beloved children.  Daniel’s activity is tilling the soil to plant coffee, cocoa beans and stevia; he’s been doing this for 25 years.  During the harvest season he hires day workers to help him in order to pick the beans faster and take them to the gathering centers to be sold.  What he considers to be difficult is eradicating pests that affect his fruit because they keep him from getting a good crop yield.  Therefore, he’s turning to MFP to request a loan that will help him with his work plan and not damage his crops.  

This is loan #7 and he feels happy for the trust placed in him so he commits to be punctual with his installment payments.  He thanks his communal bank for letting him work with responsible, supportive people.  He will use the 1,000 new soles to buy manure so that the pests won’t affect his fruit plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav, age 26, operates a cellphone and cellphone parts sales business out of a rented stall in the local trade center in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 and has made much progress with his endeavor. 

Purevjav lives with his wife and their two-year-old baby daughter in Ulaanbaatar. He graduated from the Agricultural University of Mongolia in 2007, with a bachelor's degree in Plant Quarantine Inspection. His wife works as a local broker dealer, so Purevjav's younger sister still babysits their daughter during the day. Purevjav is a young man who is striving to make a great success in his life and live happily with his family.

He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan in order to purchase more mobile phones and spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: Cipriana tiene la edad de 59 años, es conviviente y  tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica  a la venta de verdura y por las noches vende salchipollo, gracias a Finca mejoró su casa y pudo mejorar la educación de sus hijos, y en su negocio su capital y su mercadería. Le gusta la capacitación por que le enseñan a ser responsable y puntual, asi como llevar su negocio y ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de  suministros como pollo, aceite, papa y otras verduras.
texts.en: Cipriana tiene la edad de 59 años, es conviviente y  tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica  a la venta de verdura y por las noches vende salchipollo, gracias a Finca mejoró su casa y pudo mejorar la educación de sus hijos, y en su negocio su capital y su mercadería. Le gusta la capacitación por que le enseñan a ser responsable y puntual, asi como llevar su negocio y ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de  suministros como pollo, aceite, papa y otras verduras.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, potatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Alberto es socio de FINCA Perú hace más de 4 años y tiene como negocio una panadería. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones porque aprende mucho de las capacitaciones, como llevar su negocio y ahorrar. También le gusta por que comparten experiencias con los socios, porque con ellos aprende mucho. Con sus ahorros ha podido arreglar su casa y le a servido para la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo que esta vez solicita lo invertirá en la compra de suministros para la elaboración de panes, tales como harina, manteca, leche, azúcar y otros.
texts.en: Alberto has been a member of FINCA Perú for four years and his business is a bakery.  He likes attending meetings because he learns much from the training like how to manage the business and how to save.   He also likes it because the members share experiences and they learn much that way.  He’s been able to use his savings to make some home improvements and they’ve also helped with his children’s schooling.  The loan he’s requesting this time will be used to buy supplies needed to bake bread like flour, shortening, milk, sugar and others.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, milk, sugar and others.

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Express Group. They are small scale businessmen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 leones from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Amadu. Amadu is age 57. He was born in the village of Sanda Bombali, but he is currently residing in Koidu, together with his wife and six children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For 27 years now, Amadu has been selling vests, socks, underpants, caps, etc. With this loan, he will buy these items wholesale to add to his business.

(Also included in the photo, second from left, is Edward, loan officer in charge of the group)

loans.use: to buy vests, socks, underpants, caps, etc., at wholesale prices to add to his business

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino es un hombre de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Florentino no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su hermano, Florentino trabaja en el rubro de la agricultura, él cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva algodón, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y porque siempre le ha gustado las labores del campo. 
Florentino se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el sostenimiento de su cultivo, tales como cubrir los gastos de riego, abono y cosecha de su cultivo; de esta manera Florentino logrará que su cultivo se logré satisfactoriamente, así el desea poder realizar una buena venta para así incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio con otros cultivos y así desea poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Florentino is a 49 year old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and their 2 children, whom he loves and are his main reason for living. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife work with all their strength to help their family get ahead. Unfortunately, a lack of economic resources and the need to work meant Florentino could not study the professional career of Agronomy as he had desired, but he would have really like to have studied it. During his free time he likes to work and sometimes cook a delicious rice with duck to share with his family.

With a lot of effort and dedication and thanks to his brother's support, Florentino works in the field of agriculture. He depends upon a small parcel of land where he cultivates cotton. He starts working every day in the early hours of the morning, and he works about 10 hours a day. He believes it is going well for him because of his dedication and because he has always liked to work in the field.

Florentino is very thankful for the Kiva lenders; thanks to their help, he can maintain his crops, by covering the expenses of irrigation, fertilization, and harvesting his crops. In this way, he can raise a good crop. He hopes to make a good sale to earn more money, which will help him a lot in the near future in expanding his business with other crops and providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: irrigate and fertilize his crops

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
Doris is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born about 32 years ago in Kamsay Tankoro, near Koidu city in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a civil servant, and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For over 10 years now, Doris has been selling plastic shoes/slippers, etc. 

Doris and her group members have applied for a loan of 800,000 for each in the group to enable them to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Doris will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is Edward, loan officer for this group)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Holly Wood Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the Holly Wood Group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Sia is the leader of this group. This 28-year-old is married to a monthly salaried worker and they have three children attending primary school. Sia has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food: palm oil, Maggi (gives sauce a sweet taste), pepper, salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items wholesale to add to her current ones. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is Edward, loan officer in charge of the group.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, Maggi, pepper, salt, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the workers who will cultivate his fields.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old, married to Peter and blessed with three children, ages 20, 18 and 15 years, respectively. She sells clothes, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Beatrice has requested a second loan of 15,000 KES to purchase three bales of clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will be reinvested back to her business. 

Her dream is to one day own a plot and build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a farmer in Murang’a area of central Kenya, where he lives with his wife. He has been in farming for two years, with coffee being his main production. He also runs a retail shop mainly dealing in agro-vet products as well.

Raphael has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his agro-vet shop business.He will specifically buy more variety of products for treating animals and stock in his shop for supply to farmers in the the area.  He is optimistic he will grow his business and become the main supplier to small holder farmers in the area. He hopes to establish a strong foundation for his family.

Raphael says Juhudi Kilimo loans are helping small holder farmers immensely.

loans.use: To boost his agro-vet retail shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 55-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electronics for 12 years. He started this business with the retirement benefits he got from a previous job. His hardships are high taxes, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goals are diversifying his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. Samuel is requesting money to buy electronics such as cables and plugs.

loans.use: to buy electronics such as cables and plugs.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is 27 years old from Gaza.  He is married and has one child.

He owns a shop for selling all kinds of paints, and he has three years' experience at this.

Tareq has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy paint and an electricity generator for his shop.  He hopes that this loan will improve his income and help him provide his son with a better future and an education.  He dreams of owning the biggest paint shop in Palestine.

loans.use: to buy paint and an electricity generator for his shop.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 39, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver and father to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Avelina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Aside from this, Avelina also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20000 PHP loan. She will use the loan with her current revolving funds to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her child a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua 1 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Fredis es una persona muy trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus hijos, en el municipio de el Triunfo al sur de Honduras.
Su negocio es una pulpería Doña Fredis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, Arroz, Café, Azúcar, Queso, Mantequilla, refrescos etc. Con el préstamo ella espera tener más productos que ofreces a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su estilo de vida.
Doña Fredis en el futuro desea tener un mini mercadito y su vez seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la educación y que sean personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Doña Delia tiene 45 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería y venta de repuestos para bicicleta ubicada en la comunidad al igual que Doña Fredis.
Doña Cristina tiene 43 años de edad su negocio es la venta de refrescos, churros y sandalias en los campos de trabajadores de las meloneras cercanas a su comunidad.
Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto 2012
texts.en:
Fredys is very hard-working and lives with her husband and children in the municipality of Triunfo, in southern Honduras. Her business is a small grocery store. Fredys needs the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, coffee, sugar, cheese, butter, refreshments, etc. With the loan, she wants to have more products to offer to her customers and therefore increase her income to improve her lifestyle.

In the future, Fredys wishes to have a mini market and at the same time keep supporting the education of her children in order for them to be good people with better opportunities. 

Delia is 45 years old, and her business is a small grocery store, where she also sells bike parts, located in the same community as Fredys. 

Cristina is 43 years old, and her business is to sell refreshments, churros and sandals in the land close to her community where the melon labors work. 

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, coffee, sugar, cheese, butter, refreshments, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey has been a client of Ugafode for close to four years. He is a farmer and does teaching to supplement his already strained resources. He would like UGX 500,000 to pay for his son's tuition. He is acquiring a loan because he does not have cash and the school wants some payment before the child begins the term. The small loan installments he repays are easier than than getting 500,000 at ago. So this helps him to remain with some money to meet other household obligations. Geofrey is very hard working.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 2 est un groupement de quatorze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Olive Colette dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Olive Colette est mariée à un certain Ange. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, trois sont leurs propres enfants. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Olive Colette a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de dix ans que Olive Colette mène comme activité la vente des tissus et des articles de mercerie à son domicile et dans son atelier. Olive Colette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Olive Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Olive Colette sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIGNON 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON 2 is a group of 14 people, whose members live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Olive Colette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old. Olive Colette is married to a certain Ange. The couple has four children who are all in school and under their care. Among the children, three are their own children. The couple live together with the children and take care of the different needs of the household together. Olive Colette stopped school at the secondary level.

For almost 10 years Olive Colette has been managing a business selling fabric and haberdashery items from her home and in her workshop. Olive Colette practices this business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs. Olive Colette gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. In seeking to satisfy her clientèle, Olive Colette is requesting a third loan with the other members of the NONVIGNON 2 group. This loan will serve to better respond to the demands of their clientèle and to make more profit for themselves. The previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 23 años y nació en Cali, Colombia. Para poder pagar sus gastos de universidad, trabajó vendiendo cd’s de música, y después como monitora de clases de fotografía, video y escritura. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es jubilado de la Gobernación del Valle del Cauca, ya que se desempeñó como vigilante por 13 años en dicha institución.  

Mónica tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en Guión y Dirección Cinematográfica y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, ya que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos del examen del TOEFL y la aplicación a las universidades.

Aquí está su historia:

Desde niña siempre he sido muy inquieta y curiosa, o bueno, eso es lo que dice mi papá cuando le preguntan por mí. Cuando me gradué del colegio, solo quería una cosa: seguir estudiando en la universidad. Quería entrar a la Universidad del Valle, la única universidad pública que hay en la ciudad, así que me lo propuse. Me inscribí a Comunicación Social. Soñaba con esa universidad, además, era la única oportunidad de estudiar que tenía, ya que mi familia no contaba con los recursos económicos para pagar una universidad privada. Uno de los momentos más felices de mi vida fue el día que vi mi nombre en la lista de admitidos a la universidad. Desde aquel día, no he dejado de soñar y de buscar hacer esos sueños realidad.


Ahora tengo un nuevo sueño: deseo estudiar en el exterior. Me interesa la realización audiovisual y el trabajo social desde el arte. Sé que al estudiar afuera fortaleceré mis habilidades y podré regresar a Colombia con las herramientas consolidadas para aportar al fortalecimiento de la industria cinematográfica en mi país, contribuyendo en la formación de públicos y nuevos realizadores y  consolidando la democratización de las imágenes a través del trabajo social desde el cine. 

Para lograrlo el primer paso ha sido pertenecer al Semillero de Talentos de Colfuturo en convenio con Proimágenes, quienes me dieron una beca para adelantar mis estudios en un segundo idioma, el inglés. Ahora, en esta nueva etapa, donde encamino todos mis esfuerzos a lograr lo que me he propuesto, el apoyo de Kiva es fundamental para seguir construyendo este sueño. 

Cuando regrese a mi país después de la maestría, quiero seguir trabajando fuerte para mostrarle al mundo que en mi país hay talento y se pueden hacer las cosas bien. Precisamente hacia allá van encaminadas mis metas a corto y largo plazo: a hacer empresa para aportar en el fortalecimiento del cine colombiano, contando nuestras historias, esas historias ricas y diversas que se encuentran en cada rincón de nuestro hermoso país, y desde allí, hacer visible esas otras valiosas y necesarias apuestas que tenemos frente al mundo, nuestras resistencias cotidianas y esperanzadoras.
texts.en:
Mónica, age 23, was born in Cali, Colombia.  In order to be able to pay for her university expenses she worked selling music CDs.  After that she worked as a photography, video, and writing instructor.  Her mother is a housewife.  Her father is retired from the Valle del Cauca government, where he worked as a security guard for 13 years.

Mónica’s dream is to get a Master’s degree in Script Writing and Film Direction.  In order to do that she needs to request Kiva’s support.  This is the only way to cover the expenses of the TOEFL exam and the applications to the universities.

Here is her story:

Ever since I was a young girl I have been very energetic and curious.  At least that is what my father says when asked about me.  When I graduated from school, I only wanted one thing, to continue studying at the university.  I wanted to attend the Universidad del Valle, the only public university in the city.  That is what I put my mind to doing.  I enrolled in Social Communication.  I dreamed about this university, and it was the only educational opportunity that I had.  My family did not have the financial resources to pay for a private university.

One of the happiest days of my life was when my name appeared on the list of those admitted to the university.  From that day on I have not stopped dreaming and striving to make my dreams come true.  

I now have a new dream.  I wish to study abroad.  I am interested in audiovisual productions and social work through art.  I know that studying abroad will strengthen my skills.  I will be able to return to Colombia with stronger tools in order to contribute to the film industry in my country.  Thus, I will be helping to educate audiences and new filmmakers.  I will help make images more democratic through cinema-based social work.  

The first step to achieving my dream has been to belong to the “Semillero de Talentos” [“Seedbed” of Talent] of Colfuturo in conjunction with Proimágenes.  They gave me a scholarship to further my studies in a second language, English.  Now, in this new phase, where I direct all of my efforts to achieve what I have proposed, Kiva’s support is fundamental in order to continue building this dream.

When I return to my country after my Master’s, I want to continue working hard to show the world that there is talent in my country, and they can do things well.

That is exactly where my short and long term goals are targeted, to do business to support the strengthening of Colombian films.  My goal is to tell our stories, these rich and diverse stories that are found in every corner of our beautiful country.  From that point, I want to attract visibility to our valuable, necessary, and differing perspectives and to our day-to-day resistances, which are full of hope.

loans.use: to pay the application expenses for a Master's program in Script Writing and Film Direction.

loans.name: Oum's Group

texts.en:
Oum is a 38-year-old mother of ten children, eight of whom still mainly need her support as they are still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

To support the big family, she has been engaging in farming rice on one hectare of farmland, while her husband works as a paid construction worker in local area to help the family generate extra income. Having been in this business for seven years, Oum and her husband can earn about KHR 27,000 per day and manage to save around KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. Flood is the main challenge for her rice-paddy as it reduces her crop production.

This is the second microloan for Oum’s group from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan, which she has been repaid back, has helped her to relieve family’s burden and improve livelihood. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Oum will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and timely so as to make her living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nohemi Berenice

texts.es: La Sra. Nohemí de 20 años de edad es casada y no tiene dependientes económicos. Es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las pruebas que ha tenido, es una mujer emprendedora ya que tiene un negocio se dedica de a la venta de comida chatarra tal como chicharrones, fritos con queso, dulces, aguas, sodas, etc. Además de esto ella organiza loterías para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gasto de su casa el trabaja en un restaurante de la localidad y entre los dos han podido salir adelante. En esta ocasión Nohemí está pidiendo de nuestra ayuda para invertir en la compra de mercancía para su negocio ya que sus clientes están pidiendo más mercancía tanto de ropa como de comida chatarra. Ella agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Nohemí, 20, is married and has no economic dependents.  She’s a woman who has known how to get ahead despite the difficult travails she’s had to go through.  She’s an enterprising woman who already has a business.   She sells second-hand clothes and also junk food like fried pork rinds, Fritos with cheese, candy, water, soft-drinks, etc.  In addition to this she also organizes lotteries to help her husband cover household expenses.  He works in a local restaurant and they’ve been able to get ahead together.
