Alejandrina manages to sell her products to the farmers who are always caring for their crops and they ask Alejandrina for advice and she helps them so they can keep their crops healthy.

However, for the record, there are difficulties too in not being able to have the natural fertilizer that the farming people need. This is why she came to the MFP office to ask for a loan so that she can supply them with their products.

This is her second loan. She agrees to make timely payments so that at another opportunity she will attain another. In her communal bank she is a happy and trustworthy member.

With the 1,000 soles, she will buy bags of natural fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizer to sell to the farmers as she advises them about caring for their crops

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las 18  integrantes del grupo son de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo lleva por nombre MUJERES UNIDAS, ya que ellas son unidas y se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una mejor vida.
SE unieron con el propósito de salir de la pobreza y darle una buena educación a sus hijos y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna necesidad. Maria es la presidenta, ella vende perfumes de todas las marcas, para hombres y mujeres, tiene muy buena clientela y sobre todo esta siempre con muchos pedidos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group are from the city of Caacupé. The group’s name is Mujeres unidas because they are united and they strive to move forward and to provide to their families everything they need for a better life. 

They are joined in their effort to escape poverty and to provide a quality education to their children such that they do not have to suffer any deprivations.

Maria is the president. She sells perfumes of all brands for both men and women. She has very good customers and above all she always has many orders. 

She is asking for this loan to purchase perfumes for men and women. With this she will be able to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for men and women for sale.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SOL NACIENTE está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ana tiene 29 años, es casada tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 7 y 1 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de San Jose,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "Rising Sun" is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Sra. Ana. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children of 7 and one year of age. She works selling food at her food stall that is located in the community of San Jose. This is her second loan with the institution. Sra. Ana is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale goods like rice, noodles and potatoes to make her dishes and thus be able to better serve her clients. Her reason for asking for the loan is to be able to continue improving in her business. She will use the benefits of the loan to continue purchasing ingredients and gain more money. Ana is a very hard working person and feels happy for the opportunity given to her since her fellow group members in many cases are working alone to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale rice, noodles, and potatoes

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde las 19 miembros son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.  Gracias a la unión que demuestran están saliendo adelante y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Florencia es la presidenta del grupo, ella cuenta que su grupo siempre se esfuerza por sobresalir y también tratan de ayudar a su comunidad en todo lo que pueden. Florencia vende perfumes de la marca Avon, que trae sobre pedido y luego sus clientes le pagan, comenta que siempre tiene buena venta y pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Renacer is from the city of Caaguazú. The 19 members are fiends and residents of the city. Thanks to their unity they are getting ahead and helping each other. 

Florencia is the president of the group. She says that the group always strives to get ahead and also help in their community as much as they can.   Florencia sells Avon perfume. She fills orders and later her customers pay her. She says she always has good sales and orders. She is asking for the loan to buy perfume so that she can fill some customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Aravoi tiene 10 mujeres como integrantes, ellas se unieron al programa de la fundacion, ya que vieron una gran ayuda y progreso no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias.
Se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo tener los ingresos necesarios para dar a sus familias e hijos todo lo que necesitan.  Maria se dedica a la olería, hacen ladrillos y otro tipo de cerámica, con lo cual salen adelante ella y su familia. Solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arcilla, que es el producto esencial  para seguir haciendo sus ladrillos.
Maria y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que reciben de Kiva y fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Aravoi has ten female members. They are united in the program of Fundación because they saw the great help and progress they could achieve not only for themselves but also for their families. 

They strive to get by and through their work they have the necessary income to provide their families and children with everything they need. 

Maria works in a pottery which produces bricks and other ceramics. This helps her and her family move forward. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of clay which is the necessary ingredient to continue making the bricks. 

Maria and her group are grateful for the help they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase clay for bricks.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIANA DE JESUS tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
	
MARIANA DE JESUS trabaja de recepcionista en un Hotel. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar la matrícula, comprar libros y cuadernos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá matricularse y comprar los libros que le hacen falta para la universidad.

La inscripción de la matrícula lo hará en la ciudad de Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es realizar un viaje largo en barco, El sueño es poder culminar los estudios. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesus is 21 years old, a single mother with a son, and lives with her son in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar. Mariana de Jesus works as a receptionist in a hotel. 

She is asking for a loan in order to pay tuition, to buy books and notebooks. With the help of the loan she could register and buy the books that she needs for university. Registration to enroll takes place in Guaranda. The challenges she faces is a long trip by boat. 

Her dream is to be able to finish her studies. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to pay tuition, and to buy the books and notebooks that she needs for university

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 45 years old, is married and has 2 children, 15 and 21 years old. He describes himself as hardworking. Jared operates a retail store where he sells electronics goods. He has been involved in this business for 14 years and employs 5 staff members. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. Jared describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from the customers.

Jared will use this KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his family members during the night. His goal is to improve his business which will be famous within 5 years. Jared hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 37, lives with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 14, in Sinkor. She has been involved in her business for the past four years and has a table in the market, where she sells ladies' dresses and blouses and men's shirts. Rita learned to sell from her mother, and her husband helped her with the initial capital to start this business. Her favorite part of the business is meeting new customers. Rita faces the challenge of low sales during the rainy season. She will use the profit generated from the business to buy more goods and to contribute to the household expenses. Rita is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe, 36, lives with her common-law spouse and her four children in a suburban neighborhood in Mombasa. She has her own business selling food at the market. Meswalehe works hard all day to earn income needed for her family’s daily sustenance.

Meswalehe is asking Yehu for her third loan of KES 35,000 to purchase flour, cooking oil, charcoal, beans, etc. Her goal is to see that her business remains stable in order to increase her income and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, charcoal, beans, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old, and she has been in active farming for over 15 years. She lives in her rural home in Nkubu area of central Kenya with her husband and two children, aged 17 and 9 years.  

She produces maize, bananas, peas, and milk. She also runs a tailoring business for additional income besides farming.

Stella has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She will buy poultry birds. She is focusing on leading in poultry business, since not many farmers have ventured into poultry in the region.  She is, however, aware of the challenge of the high cost of feed.

She hopes to earn enough income to educate her two children.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds to raise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Nkubu in central Kenya, where she lives with her family of two children, aged 13 and 7 years. She is 38 years old and has nine years of experience in farming. She currently produces maize and beans and runs her farm with one farmhand.

Lucy has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She says this will enable her diversify her farming business and earn better income, which she will channel to the education of her children. She aspires to own residential houses.

Lucy says Juhudi Kilimo services have been of great help to smallholder farmers, but points out that poor local markets and inadequate rain are the challenges farmers face.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
JUAN MIGUEL tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívra.

Juan Miguel presta sus servicios cómo guardia de seguridad en una institución pública. Solicita el crédito para comprar libros, cuadernos, lonchera, zapatos, uniforme. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Gauarnda.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los útiles escolares, uniformes, zapatos para que los hijos puedan asistir a las clases. 

El sueño es poder comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ambato. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder dar el estudio a los hijos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is a 40-year-old married father of two children. He lives with his wife and two children in the city of Guaranda, in the Bolívra province.

Juan Miguel works as a security guard at a public institute. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase books, notebooks, lunchboxes, shoes, and uniforms. He will make the purchases in the city of Guaranda.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the school supplies, uniforms, and shoes that his children need to attend school.

His dream is to be able to purchase a house in the city of Ambato. One of the challenges he faces is being able to provide his children with an education.

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, lunchboxes, shoes, and uniforms.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Olga  tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios  como ser: granos básicos, embutidos, pan, carnes, refrescos, azúcar, churros, jugos, café etc. este negocio tiene 10 meses de funcionar y ya tiene buena clientela. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y es el segundo ciclo, con el cual va surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios de consumo diario, con el objetivo de mantener siempre activo su negocio. Su plan de seguir trabajando es mantener estable el negocio y bien surtido que le genere los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, is married and has five children; she lives in Villanueva, Cortes.  Olga has her own business selling food products like basic grains, canned goods, bread, meat, soft-drinks, sugar, packaged snacks, juice, coffee, etc.  The business has been in operation ten months and already has a good clientele.  She’s always worked in commerce.

She’s asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan and this is her second cycle.  She will use it to stock her grocery store with food items that are consumed every day.  Her objective is to always keep her business active.  Her plan for continuing working is to keep the business stable and well-stocked so that it will generate the income necessary for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her grocery store..

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de polleras y mantas, pastelería, venta de cosméticos, productos de belleza, venta de ropa usada, venta de joyas y material de plata.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es una integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, ella nos cuenta que desde niña ella trabajó con su madre vendiendo ropa interior, es por esta razón que inicio su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa interior) que comprará de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la cuidad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rubi is beginning its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. It has eight members and is headed by a board with Luisa as the President. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied and among them are: clothing sales, sales of skirts and ponchos, bakery, cosmetic sales, beauty products, used clothing, silver goods and jewelry.

The loan that they are taking will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Luisa is a member. She says that she has eight cycles with Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of her sister who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling underclothing. She tells us that as a child she worked with her mother selling underclothing, which is why she began her own business.

The loan that she is asking for now is to increase her capital (to buy underclothing) that she will buy from the wholesalers and then later she will sell them as a traveling salesperson in the markets in the city of La Paz. This way of working allows her to earn income to support her family as much as possible. She lives in a free union relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loan and health training.

loans.use: to buy underclothing from wholesalers to sell in her business as a traveling salesperson in the markets of La Paz

loans.name: Romel Edison

texts.es:
ROMEL EDISON tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 
 Romel Edison se dedica a la venta de pinchos. Solicita el crédito para pagar la matrícula, comprar cuadernos.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá pagar la matrícula, comprar  lo neceesario para poder asistir a la universidad. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para culminar los estudios. La matrícula lo hara en la universidad y las compras lo hara en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es poder culminar los estudios y trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a distraerce por el parque vendiendo.
texts.en:
Romel Edison is 24 years old, a bachelor and has no children. He lives with his mother in the city of Guaranda in Bolivar Province. Romel Edison sells kebabs. He is requesting a loan to pay his registration fees and to buy books.

With help from the loan he will be able to pay to register and buy all that he needs to attend the university. The challenge that he faces is the lack of money to finish his studies. He will pay his registration fees at the university and he will buy his books in the city of Guaranda. 

His dream is to finish his studies and work. In his spare time he enjoys going to the park to amuse himself and to sell kebabs.

loans.use: to pay his university registration fees and buy books.

loans.name: El Manantial (Ganadería) Group

texts.es: El Grupo Manantial se encuentra en una comunidad muy tranquila donde las personas se caracterizan por ser humildes y muy sencilla pero sobre todo siempre muy respetuosa el grupo está conformado por 6 mujeres muy trabajadoras que además de sus tareas domesticas son mujeres emprendedoras ya que cada una de ellas tiene una actividad productiva como es por eso que están solicitando el crédito a la institución como por ejemplo las señoras Paulina, Elvira, Gloria, Romualda, compraran borregos para cría y engorda para que en un futuro puedan vender mientras que doña María invertirá en productos lácteos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, las integrantes del grupo no saben porque se llama así el grupo ya que las personas que iniciaron el grupo ya no están trabajando con la institución sin embargo ellas creen que el nombre lo eligieron porque en la comunidad donde viven existen varios manantiales que son de gran ayuda a la población cuando en su comunidad no hay agua potable, Doña Elvira es una integrante del grupo manantial nos platica que tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Melquiades desde hace 15 años juntos han formado una familia con 6 niños los cuales tres de ellos asisten a la escuela de la comunidad Doña Elvira argumenta “Siempre he vivido en la comunidad y desde pequeña he visto todas las costumbres que se tienen en la comunidad como los platillos que se comen, las fiestas que se celebran, la vestimenta típica, lo que se cultiva, lo que se cría y también a través de los años he visto como se van quedando en el olvido de todo esto a lo que veo y he aprendido de mi comunidad es criar animales como los borregos en casa tengo 3 borregos pero pienso comprar 5 borregos mas y pastura la actividad la inicie ya individualmente hace 5 años quien me ayudo mucho para tener éxito en mi actividad fue mi suegra ya que fue me enseño tips importantes para lograr mi éxito. La única dificultad que presento algunas es la falta de información para cuidar mejor a mis borregos ya que muchas veces enferman y mueren si me gustaría capacitarme para saber qué hacer en esta cuestión esta vez con el crédito voy a comprar madera para mejorar y hacer más grande el corral de mis borregos porque solo tengo tres y si compro los cinco borregos mas ya no van a caber y van a estar muy incómodos todos juntos, mis borregos los compro desde chicos para crecerlos y engordarlos para después venderlos a un mejor precio porque entre más grandes y gordos estén mejor es la paga, para lograr  todo esto por las mañanas les limpio el corral donde duermen después les doy de comer zacate seco y les pongo su agua para cuando se les ofrezca y por la tarde después de que mis hijos regresan de la escuela les voy de comer y nos  vamos todos a pastar a mis borregos al llano es lo que más me gusta porque ahí mis hijos juegan futbol se divierten mucho así yo cuido de mis borregos y de mis hijos” cuando le cuestionamos cual era su meta sonriendo nos dijo “Arreglar mi casa ya no quiero que goteé como coladera ya que cuando llueve se moja mucho y no se cómo controlar la goteadera y para mis hijos quiero que terminen una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
The ‘Manatial” [Spring] group is in a very peaceful community where the people are known for being humble and very unassuming.  Above all, the group is always very respectful.  It is comprised of six very hard-working women, who, in addition to their household chores, are entrepreneurs.  Each one of them has a productive business activity.

That is why they are requesting a loan from the institution.  For example, Paulina, Elvira, Gloria, and Romualda buy sheep to raise and fatten.  They are later able to sell them.  María will invest in dairy products to stock her grocery store.

The group members do not know why its name was chosen.  The people who started the group are no longer working with the institution.  Nevertheless, they believe that it is because the place where they live has many small springs.  These are very helpful to the inhabitants when their community does not have potable water.

Elvira is a member of the Manantial group.  She tells us that she is 33 years old, and she has been married to Melquiades for 15 years.  Together they have formed a family with six children, three of whom go to the community school.  Elvira explains, “I have always lived in the community.  Ever since I was little I have seen all of the community’s customs like the dishes that are eaten, the holidays that are celebrated, the typical clothing, what is grown, and what is raised.  Also, through the years I have seen how all of this is being forgotten.  What I have learned from my community is raising animals like the sheep that I have at home.  I have three sheep, but I am thinking of buying five more and fodder.  I started this business activity individually five years ago.  The person who helped me a lot to be successful in my business activity was my mother-in-law.  She taught me important tips in order to be successful.  The only difficulty I encountered is the lack of information about how to take better care of my sheep.  Many times they get sick and die.  I would like to get training in order to know about this issue.

This time I will use the loan to buy wood to improve and enlarge the sheep corral.  I only have three, and if I buy five more sheep, they will not fit.  All of them together will be very uncomfortable.  I bought my sheep when they were little in order for them to grow and fatten so that I could later sell them for a better price.  When they are bigger and fatter, the pay is better.  In order to achieve all of this, in the mornings I clean the corral where they sleep.  After that I give them dried grass to eat, and I provide them with water. 

In the afternoon, after my children get home from school, I feed them.  Then we all go to the plains for my sheep to graze.  This is what I like the best because my children play soccer there, and they have a lot of fun.  This way I take care of my sheep and my children.”  When we asked her what her goal is, she smiled and said, “Fixing my house because I don’t want it to leak like a sieve.  When it rains it gets very wet, I do not know how to control the leaking.  My goal for my children is for them to complete their studies, and earn a professional degree."

loans.use: to buy wood to improve and enlarge the sheep corral.

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
Cesar Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su madre.
El es una persona emprendedora, desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender  chicharrones de soya en bolsitas en ristras, también vende  especies y condimentos (cominos, pimiento, canela, ajo, etc.) tajadas de plátano y sorpresas (confites con un juguetito para niños). Además siempre vende helados en vasitos. Distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante transportándose en bicicleta. Al negocio le dedica todo el día ya que compra el producto, lo prepara en bolsitas y ristra y lo vende. Va por el cuarto ciclo de préstamo, actualmente solicita 9,000 Lempiras, que lo utilizara para seguir surtiendo de materia prima como: chicharrones, especies, condimentos, juguetes, y otros insumos para su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Manuel, 29, is single and lives in Tela, Atlántida with his mother.  He’s an enterprising person who has been selling soy ‘chicharrones’ [imitation pork rinds] packaged in strips of little bags.  He also sells spices and condiments (cumin, pepper, cinnamon, garlic, etc.); fried banana strips and surprises (sweets for children with a surprise toy inside).  He also sells ice-cream in small glasses.  He sells from place to place getting around on a bicycle.  He works all day in his business because he buys the product, prepares the little bags, arranges them in strips and sells them.

He’s starting his fourth loan cycle and this time is asking for a 9,000 Lempira loan that he’ll use to continue stocking up on raw materials like “chicharrones,” spices, condiments, toys and other supplies for his business.  His goal is to continue growing with the business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy "chicharrones," suprises (little toys for children), condiments and spices to package and sell in strips.

loans.name: Marjorie Alicia

texts.es:
MARJORIE ALICIA tiene 33 años de edad es soletra no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventannas provincia de los ríos.

MARJORIE ALICIA presta los servicios en algunas casas de la región. Solicita el crédito para comprar muebles, y una computadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de guaranda.

El sueño es poder comprar una casa. los desfíos a los que se enfrenta es poder seguir trabajando. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en: Marjorie Alicia, 33, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She provides service in local houses and is asking for the loan to buy furniture and a computer.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy what she so needs.  She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house and the challenge she faces is to be able to continue working.  In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy furniture and a computer.

loans.name: Yesit

texts.es:
Yesit, es soltero pero tiene dos hijos; vive en una casa alquilada ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Alemania de la ciudad de El Alto.

Yesit, estudió hasta secundaria  y actualmente es socio en una línea de trufis y trabaja como chofer asalariado en el área del transporte público por más de ocho horas al día, de esta forma él cubre los gastos de alimentación, médicos, pago de  alquiler y otros servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de la movilidad  de su propiedad (cambio de aceites, chequeo de frenos, balanceo de llantas) para prestar un buen servicio a sus pasajeros y mejorar sus ingresos ya que es su única fuente de trabajo.

El sueño de Yesit, es tener su casa propia para mejorar su calidad de vida y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yesit is single but has two children.  He lives in a rented, three-bedroom house with adobe walls and dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Alemania zone.  Yesit studied up to secondary school and is currently a partner in a cooperative taxi line working as a salaried driver providing public transportation service for more than 8 hours daily.  This is how he pays for food, medical expenses, rent and other basic services.

He needs the loan to provide general service for his car (oil change, break check, tire balancing) to provide good customer service and improve his income since this is his only source of income.  Yesit’s dream is to own a house to improve his quality of life and provide more comfort for his family.  This is the fourth time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Cervezas, dulces y productos d e panaderías fue lo que compró Ledis con su anterior credikiva, con el que se fortaleció, aumentando su capital de trabajo, surtió muy bien y satisfizo las necesidades de su clientela. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento y con el planea continuar aumentando sus ingresos aumentando sus ventas, porque agregará a sus oferta nuevos productos de tocador, así es que comprará  refrescos y bebidas, derivados de la harina de trigo, y productos de tocador. Ella agradece mucho por la ayuda de Kiva y por esa maravillosa labor que están haciendo.
texts.en: Beer, sweets, and baked goods are the products that Ledis purchased with her previous Kiva loan. With the loan, she strengthened her business by increasing her working capital, so she was able to restock her shop well and meet her customer's needs. She is now requesting a new loan with which she plans to keep increasing her income by increasing sales, since she will now offer personal care products for sale. She will purchase liquor, soft drinks, wheat products, and personal care products. She is very grateful for Kiva's help and for the wonderful work that they are doing.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, liquor, wheat products, and personal care products.

loans.name: Wilma Eulalia

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma tiene 37 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 21, 17, 14 y 10,  ella se dedica al comercio de chuño, tunta y kaya estos son cereales deshidratados, su tienda se encuentra en la zona de  Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Wilma  va a usar este préstamo de para compra por cargas tunta papa chuño y caya por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Wilma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Wilma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Wilma is 37 years old, married, and has four children, who are ages 21, 17, 14 and 10. Wilma makes a living selling dry crops and grains, including: chuño (a species of potato), tunta (a white, potato-like root), and caya. Her store is located in the Achachicala district in the city of La Paz. This is her third loan with this institution, and Wilma plans to use the support from the loan to purchase dry grains in bulk to stock her business, as sales tend to increase toward the end of the year. 

The most significant challenge Wilma faces in operating her business is competition. Wilma is a very hardworking person, and is grateful for this opportunity. She hopes that the benefits from this loan and investment will help her to increase her stock of merchandise and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry grains to stock her business.

loans.name: Rieles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rieles” está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre los integrantes son familiares  y el nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente por eso pero también porque el lujar donde ellos viven están unos Rieles que es por donde pasaban el transporte pero con el tiempo desapareció nos platica Don Felipe que empezaron a construir encima de esos rieles y ahora ya solo se alcanza a apreciar una parte de los rieles, Don Felipe quien es el represente nos platica que tiene 54 años de edad, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria se caso con la señora María juntos formaron una familia hijos pero por el momento solo tienen un hijo que se encuentra estudiando y una nieta que también está  a su cargo, Don Felipe nos platica “Yo me dedico a la cría de animales por el momento solo tengo siete cerdos y dos reces en la actividad tengo ya 17 años de experiencia, inicie mi negocio porque tenía que obtener otra entrada de dinero aunque trabajo como obrero muchas veces la familia necesita otras cosas y es por eso que me decidí criar animales ya que es una actividad muy buena que se puede desarrollar muy bien en la comunidad, pero también inicie porque tenía un amigo que me invito a criar animales y me motivo mucho porque desde al principio me ofreció una tanda de cerdos que tenia para mí y se  acepte y así fue como empecé a criar animales, es por eso que estoy solicitando un nuevo crédito con la institución para comprar alimento para cerdos para engordar a sus cerdos, es una dificultad por la cual estoy atravesando la falta de dinero para comprar más alimento pero gracias al crédito el podre comprar el alimento, hace tiempo yo llegue  a tener  cerdas grandes que podían darme hasta 25 lechones (cerdos chicos)  me iba muy bien sin embargo un buen día me invitaron para hacerme cargo del puesto de delegado el cual acepte pero absorbía mucho mi tiempo y fue cuando empecé a tener problemas con mis animales, dos cerdas que estaban a punto de parir perdieron todos sus lechones por salta de atención, llegue a perder 50 lechones en un mismo día, si mis cerdos que tengo en casa y mis reces crecen en muy poco tiempo podre vender mis cerdos a muy buen precio con atención y que estén muy bien alimentados en cuatro meses podre recuperarme en la misma cantidad, quiero que mis animales crezcan y siga yo teniendo mucho más para que mis hijos puedan seguir estudiando ya que deseo que ellos terminen una carrera donde puedan realizarse profesionalmente.”  Don Felipe es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable lo único que quiere es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Doña María y Celia forman parte del grupo quienes también se dedican e invertirán en los animales que tiene Don Felipe ya que es una actividad compartida.
texts.en:
The “Rieles” group is two women and one man; they are all related to each other and they chose the group name precisely because of that but also because there are some railroad tracks in the place where they live left over from the time in the past when trains which have since disappeared passed by here.  Construction started to happen on top of the tracks and now just parts of them are still visible.

Felipe is the group representative and he relates that he’s 54-years-old and only studied up to fourth grade in elementary school.  He married María and they formed a family and had children.  Currently, though, they only have one son left at home who is attending school and a granddaughter who is also in their care.  Felipe relates that he has worked raising animals and at the moment has only seven pigs and two heads of cattle.  He has 17 years’ experience in this activity.  He started it because he had to find another source of income because even though he worked as a laborer often his family needed other things and that’s why he decided to start raising animals which is a very good activity that can be developed well in his community.  But he also got into it because a friend invited him to raise some animals and that motivated him very much because at the very beginning he gave him a litter of pigs that he’d set aside for him and he accepted it and that’s how he started to raise animals.  

This is why he’s asking for a loan from the institution in order to buy feed for the pigs to fatten them up.  The lack of cash to buy more feed is a difficulty he’s going through at present but thanks to the loan he will be able to buy the feed.  Some time ago he reached the point of having large sows that produced up to 25 piglets.  He did very well and one day he was asked to accept the position of delegate and he accepted but it absorbed too much of his time and he started to have problems with his animals.  Two of the sows that were about to give birth lost their entire litters because of lack of care.  He lost 50 piglets in a single day.  If the pigs and cattle he has at home now grow well in a short period of time he will be able to sell the pigs at a good price.  With good care and being fed well he’ll be able to recuperate and reach the same number in four months.   He wants his animals to grow and he wants to have much more so that his children can continue going to school because he wants them to have careers where they can develop professionally.  Felipe is a very hardworking, responsible man.  All he wants is a better quality of life for his family.  

María and Celia are part of the group; they also raise animals and will also invest in Felipe’s animals because this is a shared activity.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sara Lizette

texts.es:
Sara, de oficio comerciante, habita en la ciudad de Managua , de profesión contadora , pero debido a la escasez de trabajo , se dedica a atender un negocio de pulpería y fotocopiadora. Tiene dos hijos de 26 y 20 años de edad. 
Empezó con una caja de cuadernos y un pequeño capital de trabajo, alquilaba una fotocopiadora, después fue comprando vitrina y botes para caramelos y galletas. De granito en granito fue juntando para lograr comprar más productos y lograr poner la pulpería, la cual  tiene en su casa. Su anhelo es lograr tener surtido su negocio de pulpería con variedad de productos de uso doméstico y al mismo tiempo ofrecer el servicio de fotocopia con tecnología avanzada que le permitan ahorrar energía.
Ella requiere el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, enlatados, avenas, papel higiénico, pasta dental, gaseosas, jugos, leche, huevo, pan al mismo tiempo en comprar algunos artículos de uso para su negocio de fotocopiadora. En lo futuro le gustaría invertir en un negocio de farmacia.
texts.en:
Sara, a merchant by trade, lives in the city of Managua.  She's a professional accountant but has a store and photocopying business because of the scarcity of jobs.  She has two children, ages 26 and 20.

She started with a box of notebooks and a small amount of working capital.  She rented a photocopier, then bought a display case and jars for candy and cookies.  Little by little she got the money together and managed to buy more products and set up a store, which she has in her house.

Her desire is to supply her store with a variety of products for household use as well as offer photocopying services with advanced technology that will allow her to save energy.

She needs the loan to buy basic necessities, oil, sugar, canned goods, oatmeal, toilet paper, toothpaste, soda, juice, milk, eggs, and bread.  She also needs to buy some things for her photocopying business.

In the future she would like to invest in a pharmacy business.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities to stock her store and some things for her photocopying business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, de 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres en su haber. Juntos residen en su casa propia donde se brindan amor  y cuidado. El señor Julián se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura; en compañía de su esposa se dirigen a los campos de cultivo desde la madruga para dirigirse a su parcela donde tiene cultivado plantas de café, lleva 19 años obteniendo la producción de café y en tiempos de colecta ve los resultados de todo el empeño que pone desde el tiempo que llegó a cultivar hasta el día de su cosecha. Julián, considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con los animales que afectan a sus plantas; por lo que disminuye sus frutos; es por eso que acude a las oficinas de MFP, para poder solicitar un préstamo que ayude a tener buena producción. Este es su crédito número 03, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además, se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, servirá para darle un mejoramiento de sus plantaciones de café comprando abono orgánico.
texts.en: Julián is a 33-year-old married man with three children. His family lives in their own house, which is filled with love and caring. He is a farmer, and at dawn he goes with his wife to his parcel of land where he grows coffee plants. He has 19 years of experience producing coffee, and each year at harvest time he sees the results of the painstaking efforts he has made throughout the growing season. He believes that the most difficult aspect of this is not to be able to control the animals that are affecting his plants and diminishing his yield of coffee beans. For this reason he came to MFP in order to seek a loan that will help him obtain a better harvest. This is his third loan. He promises to repay his loan in a timely manner. Further, he feels satisfied with his communal bank. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will make improvements to his coffee crop, buying organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose, tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. El lleva 8 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos de todo tipo de soldadura y pintura de vehículos, portones de metal, balcones de hierro y otros aparatos de metal. El taller lo tiene establecido en su casa y atiende a sus clientes todo el día. En busca de obtener más ingresos don Jose ha solicitado un tercer préstamo a ODEF para comprar cerdos para engorde y venta ya que viene la temporada buena de este negocio y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad, y también se va abastecer de materiales que necesita en su taller como ser: lijas, pinturas, estaño, etc. el tiene varios planes en su vida que son: mejorar su negocio, de las ganancias hacer mejoras a su vivienda y ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en: José, 40, lives with his wife and two children in Tela, Atlántida.  He’s been working for 8 years doing all sorts of work like welding and painting cars, metal gates, metal balconies and other metal structures.  His shop is at home and he tends to customers all day.  He hopes to earn more income and José is requesting his third loan from ODEF to buy pigs to fatten up and sell because the good season for this business is approaching and he wants to take advantage of the opportunity.  He’s also going to stock up on supplies needed for his shop like sandpaper, paint, tin, etc.  He has several life goals like to improve his business and use the profits to do home improvements and help with his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his auto body repair shop and pigs to fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is from a small village of Tskaltubo district. He is 55 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and 9-year-old grandson. His grandson goes to the local school. Nodar’s son has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. His daughter-in-law works at the local supermarket as a saleslady to earn a small monthly income. Nodar buys bread and provides local families with it. Additionally, he sows vegetables in the open ground and sells different kinds of greens during the year and cucumbers, seasonally. The family runs a small dairy farm as well and has 2 milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese products. They sell their dairy production locally. Nodar works hard to make some savings and expand his agricultural business. 

He requested a loan to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. He will sow onions, and after fertilization and properly done seasonal work, Nodar will be able to get a good harvest.  He confronts challenges such as pest infestations and diseases and changes in the weather, so that he can provide quality products for his customers. This will increase his income and Nodar will reinvest in his agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable. All members of the family will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwadzina

texts.en:
Mwadzina owns a fish-selling stall which is located at the market. He lives in Tiribe, Kenya with his wife and six children. He has been associated with Yehu Microfinance Trust for over 1 year. During this time he has seen his business grow thanks to Yehu.

Mwadzina highly values education for his children and is looking for ways to provide for his youngest, who are still under his charge. This is the reason why he is motivated to sell fish to provide better education for his children. 

He is grateful to Yehu for the help it has given him. On a personal level, his business has provided him with independence and now provides his family basic needs. With the loan, he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: San Alejandro Agricultura Group

texts.es: Berenice tiene 23 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad llamada San Alejandro y dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo para que ubicaran más rápido el grupo, platica que ella tiene varios ciclos trabajando con Visión Fund atravez de los créditos y que le ha ido muy bien porque ha mejorado las condiciones de su negocio que es el cultivo y venta de flor de noche buena. Comenta que tiene con este negocio desde hace mas de 5 años y que está muy orgullosa de su negocio por que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como el poder desarrollarse como microempresaria, dice que empezó el negocio por que su esposo y ella no tenían un trabajo estable y ella pidió un crédito para poder comprar lo necesario para hacer el vivero como el armazón y el plástico que lleva y que decidieron ese negocio por que su esposo ya  había trabajado como jornalero cuidando viveros y decidieron hacer su propio vivero. Platica que el primer año echaron poca planta por que no tenían a quien venderle la flor pero poco a poco se han ido aclientando años con año y que este es su sexto año consecutivo que van a volver a cultivar y a vender esta hermosa flor decembrina. Dice que ahorita están echando de diferentes variedades como la suljibri, freedom, mármol rosa, marbell, star, blanca y sonora y que ya están pintando sus flores y que en el mes de noviembre ya están listas para venderse por mayoreo a sus clientes, ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abono, insecticidas y papel para envolverla y venderla, ella espera que con este crédito pueda aumentar un poco mas su producción ya que así podrá darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. La meta que tiene Berenice para su negocio es hacer otro vivero ya que nada mas tiene dos y ella espera poder hacer otro para aumentar el siguiente año la producción de la flor de noche buena. Las otras cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman Veronica, Braulia, Leticia, Sonia y Rosa Elena ellas invertirán en sus negocios de cultivo y venta de flores de noche buena.
texts.en:
Berenice, 23, is from a community called San Alejandro and she says that’s the name they gave to their group so that the group can be located more quickly.  She relates that she’s been working with Visión Fund loans for several cycles and she’s done very well because she’s improved her poinsettia growing and selling business’ conditions.  She comments that she’s had this business for five years and she’s very proud of her business because it’s given her much satisfaction like being able to develop as a businesswoman.  She says that she started this business because her husband and she did not have stable jobs and she requested a loan to buy what was necessary, like the structure and the plastic sheeting, to set up a nursery.  They decided on that particular business because her husband had already worked as a day laborer caring for nurseries and they decided to have one of their own.

She relates that the first year they only planted a few plants because they had no one to sell the plants to but gradually as the years have gone by they’ve acquired customers; this is their sixth consecutive year of planting and selling this beautiful December plant.  She says that they are now planting different varieties like Suljibri, Freedom, Pink Marble, Marbell, Star, White and Sonora.  The flowers are already attaining their color and in the month of November they will be ready to be sold at wholesale to her customers.  

Right now she’s asking for a loan to buy manure, insecticide and paper to wrap them for sale.  She hopes with the loan to increase production a bit more because she’ll  be able to give her children a better quality of life that way.  Berenice’s business goal is to build another nursery because she only has two and she hopes to be able to build another one to increase poinsettia production next year.

The other five group members are Verónica, Braulia, Leticia, Sonia and Rosa Elena.  They will use their loans for their poinsettia growing and selling businesses.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, insecticides and flowerpots to grow poinsettia.

loans.name: Elan Hector

texts.es:
Elan es un hombre de 22 años, soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Camaná, caracterizada por clima cálido y hermosas playas; Elan es un hombre muy trabajador, persevante, con un gran sentido del humor, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y hermanos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Seco de Pollo” para compartir con su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Agronomía. Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su familia, Elan se dedica a la agricultura ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno en el cual cultiva, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria, él se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo. 

Elan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que es la segunda vez que los prestatarios Kiva le brindan su apoyo y gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo; ya que actualmente he sembrado frejol de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos económicos para con ellos adquirir una motocarga que le servirá para el riego de sus futuras siembras y así de esta manera espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de estudiar la carrera de agronomía para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elan is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Camaná, which is well-known for its warm weather and beautiful beaches. Elan is a very hardworking, persevering man with a great sense of humor. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and brothers, and on some occasions, he makes a delicious seco de pollo, South American chicken stew, to share with his family. Unfortunately, he was unable to pursue his studies because of a lack of financial resources, but he dreams of studying agronomy. Thanks to his enterprising spirit and to his family's support, Elan works in agriculture since he has a small plot of land which he farms. He works in his business approximately 12 hours a day. He is very content with his business since he has always liked working the fields very much.

Elan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as this is the second time that they give him their support. Thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase both organic and chemical fertilizer, and to maintain his crops. He has just planted beans and with this loan, he will be able to harvest his crops and increase his income. He will then obtain a three-wheel utility van so that he can help irrigate his future crops, thus he will be able to realize his dream of getting a degree in agronomy and helping his family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizer, as well as other products.

loans.name: Marisol Diana

texts.es:
Marisol es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Marisol no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Marisol puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, tales como gaseosas, refrescos, agua, cerveza, entre otros; todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque no tiene mucha competencia en su zona y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marisol se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un toldo, mesas y sillas para su negocio; de esta manera Marisol tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado donde sus clientes puedan estar mas cómodos y se sientan a gusto, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marisol, 22, lives in the city of Ica.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic, single woman who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work to cover expenses, Marisol was unable to become a secretary like she so desired but would have liked to have done so.  In her free time she likes to keep working and sometimes cooks a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Marisol opened a small beverage business selling soft-drinks, beverages, water and beer, among others.  She starts work very early in the morning every day.  She works approximately 12 hours per day on average and believes she does well because she does not have much competition in her zone and because of the kind customer service she provides.

Marisol is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a tarp, tables and chairs for her business.  In this way, Marisol will have the business better equipped so that her customers will be more comfortable and feel at ease.  She hopes her sales and income will increase as a result and it will be very useful for her to expand the business and have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tarp, tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Sr. Joel  tiene 41 años es casado con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 7, 11, 13 y 15 años, el se dedica al comercio minorista, el tiene a la  venta relojes, perfumes, calculadoras y  flash memorias, su puesto se encuentra en la zona de Victoria, este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, el Sr. Joel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como relojes y calculadoras y así de esta  manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería para surtir su puesto, el Sr. Joel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de producto y sueña con ampliar su casa y su negocio, el Sr. Joel se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito
texts.en:
Joel is a 41-year-old married man with four children aged 7, 11, 13 and 15.  He sells retail products such as watches, perfumes, calculators and flash memory.  He has a stall in the area of Victoria.

This is his first loan with this institution.  He will use the funds to by merchandise such as watches and calculators to add to his stock and have them available for resale. He faces challenges in his business, such as the demand for new products.  He will utilize the loan proceeds in a careful effort to buy a variety of products.

He dreams of expanding his business and his home.  He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support and this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy watches, perfumes, calculators and flash memory.

loans.name: Valeria Alexandra

texts.es:
VALERIA ALEXANDRA tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Valeria Alexandra es ayudante de cocina en un restaurante. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar libros, cuadernos, y pagar la matrícula del tercer ciclo. Las compras y el pago de matrículas lo harán en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Con la ayuda del crédito tendra la oportunidad de seguir estudiando.

El sueño es ponerce un negocio. El desfío al que se encfrenta es culminar los estudios. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en el campo
texts.en:
Valeria Alexandra is 20 year old, single, and has no children. She lives with her family in the city of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province.

Valeria is a cook's assistant at a restaurant. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase books and notebooks, and to pay for her third semester tuition. She will make the purchases and pay for tuition in the city of Guaranda.

With the help of this loan, she will have the opportunity to continue studying.

Her dream is to launch her own business. One of the challenges she faces is finishing her studies. In her free time, she likes to work in the fields.

loans.use: to purchase books and notebooks, and to pay for her third semester tuition.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Milly has a business of selling roasted green bananas and has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting. She has been in this business for 12 years and works at the market 7 days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to start going to villages for green bananas and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen, 26,  lives at Sinkor with her husband and two children, ages 2 and 8. She stopped her education in the 9th grade. Her husband is a businessman. 

Ellen has been involved in selling fish for the past 10 years. Her husband helped her with the initial capital to start in this business. She sells dry fish and  fresh fish in the community market. Her favorite part of the business is that she always has money to attend to her children's needs. Ellen is requesting this loan to purchase more cartons of fresh fish and dry fish for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fresh fish and dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has five children; only one of her children goes to school.  She takes care of additional family members (grand children).  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years and works from home seven days a week. She sells to all categories of people by retail. 

Mariam's major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring to see her business grow larger so that she can become a wholesaler. She also hopes to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift Kenya where he lives with his children, who are aged between seven and twenty years. Jones runs a retail shop business besides his farming.

Jones has made a request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of a dairy cow will help him to boost his dairy farming, a business which he has been carrying out alongside tea farming.

Jones says the major challenge in the farming business is lack of capital and reiterates that the Juhudi Kilimo loans will help mitigate this challenge immensely.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ful Ignatius

texts.en:
He is married and blessed with six lovely kids, five of whom are below the age of 15 years. This family lives in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Many are the difficulties he has encountered in life such as ill health amongst his family, especially himself, insolence of his own children, an accident with a motorbike which he was involved, dejection by his family especially of his own sister, uncle and auntie. His problems were further compounded by general poverty and lack of start-up capital.

He intends on using this loan amount to operate a natural medicine store. That is, increase stocks of herbal medicines, buy honey, kernel oil, and castor oil. He believes the venture will succeed because of its strategic location (he is the only one), good media publicity of his products and services, and high demand from customers. This activity will help his community in providing natural and affordable medicine, reduce incidence of some diseases and illnesses, like gastrointestinal problems. From his business the profits will be used to provide better healthcare and education for his family, as well as improve clothing and housing conditions of his family.

loans.use: finance the operation of a natural medicine store

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Chito is from the village of Tskaltubo district. She is 51 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. The family runs the agricultural business. They have a greenhouse where cucumbers, tomatoes and different kinds of greens are grown. Chito also sows vegetables in open ground and does all relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold in different parts of the district, using the family-owned car. In addition, the family sells the part of the harvest at the local open market. Chito works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of her family. 

She has requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizers for her greenhouse. The loan will help her to provide financially for her needs. After fertilization and properly done agricultural works, Chito will receive a good quality harvest and sell it at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in her agricultural business, to expand and make it more profitable. The increased profit will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Earnest  is a 35 year old married man. He has 5 children, ages ranging from 1 year to 14 years. He describes himself to be focused man. 

Earnest operates a motorcycle, providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a viable business environment  and his primary customers are daily passengers from his home area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent break down of the motorcycle. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house for his family. He previously took a loan of KES 20,000 with SMEP DTM, which he managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a farmer in Litein, South Rift Kenya where she has practiced farming for six successive years. Her products include milk and tea, which she sells within the local market, the latter being her greatest source of income.

Sharon has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She hopes to improve her milk production capacity with the acquisition of this additional dairy cow. She is focusing on building a modern dairy unit for her growing number of dairy cows. She says, however, that farmers in the area are all facing a common problem with animal diseases.

Sharon is married and has five children, all of whom are in schooling.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is from the small village of Baghdati district. She is 53 years old, divorced and lives with her mother. She works as a librarian at the local library and gets a monthly salary. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and do all the relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. They pick the grapes and produce wine and vodka. Ketevan also owns a nut garden and a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown.  She sells her agricultural products locally. Ketevan is very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Ketevan has applied for this loan to purchase a milk cow. This will allow Ketevan to receive milk, produce cheese products and sell these products in her village at a good price. She will have an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and expand her agricultural business as well with this loan. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a person who is notable for being responsible, hardworking and serious about what she does. She has a well-stocked shop. She also has a poultry business. She is thankful for the previous loan that enabled her to increase her inventory.

Bakari works raising chickens, a business that helps her meet her household expenses. The loan she’s asking for now is to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. This investment will help Bakari to earn an improved income to cover her household expenses.

She thanks you for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a mother and a farmer in her rural home area in Litein, where she has been living with three children after having been widowed. She currently produces milk and pineapples.

Winny has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use the money to construct a zero grazing unit. She is optimistic that she will manage the farming business and improve the family's provisions.

She says lack of well-established markets is the challenge in farming.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Luz Sofia

texts.es:
LUZ SOFIA tiene 35 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y con los padres en la ciudad de Gauaranda provincia de Bolivar.

Luz Sofía tiene un taller de confección de trajes ternos, faldas , uniformes, arreglos de pantalones. Solicita el crédito para pagar la matrícula de los hijos y comprar los útilies escolares.

La matricula y la compra de los útiles lo hará en la ciudad de Guaranda. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá  matricular a los hijos y comprar los útiles para que puedan asistir a la escuela. 

El sueño es poder ayudar a los hijos que puedan culminar los estudios. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la delincuencia y la inseguridad  en las calles. 

En elt iempo libre le gusta estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Luz Sofia is a 35-year-old married mother of three. She lives with her children and parents in the city of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province.

Luz Sofia owns a tailor shop in which she makes three-piece suits, skirts, uniforms, and alterations. She is requesting this loan in order to pay for her children's tuition and school supplies.

She will pay for the tuition and the school supplies in the city of Guaranda. With the help of this loan, she will be able to enroll her children in school and pay for the supplies they need in order to attend.

Her dream is to help her children finish their studies. The challenges she faces have to do with delinquency and the unsafe streets in her area.

She likes to spend her free time with family.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition and school supplies.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel está muy agradecido con Kiva porque con su crédito compró calzado, bolso y 2 planes de celulares. Sus ventas se han incrementado ya que ampió mas su negocio con la mercancia  y los planes de celulares. Su nuevo credito lo invertirá comprando calzado para damas, caballeros y ropa en general, tambien comprará otro plan a celular, porque su demanda de este servicio se ha incrmentado. Su sueño es tener un buen local donde ubicar su negocio, para generar un ambiente mas confortable a su clientela. El envia el siguiente mensaje a los finaciaores: "Estoy muy agradecido Y que sigan apoyandonos a los pequeños empresarios con sus créditos: "
texts.en: Israel is very grateful to Kiva because he used his loan to buy shoes, purses and two mobile phone plans.  His sales have increased because he expanded his business with more merchandise and the mobile phone plans.  He will use his new loan to buy women’s and men’s shoes and clothes in general.  He will also buy another mobile phone plan because demand for this service has increased.  His dream is to have a good locale in which to set up his business to create a more comfortable environment for his customers.  He sends the following message to lenders:   “I’m very grateful.  Continue helping us small businessmen with your loans.”

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, milk products, sugar, bread, soft drinks, hair bands, CD's, nail files, and oil, etc for his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 45 years old, is from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married and has four children who are aged between 19 years and 25 years old.

Lucy is a farmer and has been participating in farming activities for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD. to enable her buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm.

She hopes to expand her business and get good profits in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María es una persona trabajadora, responsable, que le gustaría mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y triunfar en la vida. María vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en Riobamba.

María con su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ellos siembran alcachofa en grandes cantidades para poder distribuir en los mercados, actualmente debido al mal clima necesita invertir en la compra de abonos, fungicidas para curar todo el sembrío caso contrario su producción se dañaría y generaría pérdidas. También necesita invertir en la compra de semillas de otros productos como maíz fréjol para incrementar sus ingresos y para pagar a recolectores de alcachofas.

María sueña en exportar su producto a varios países y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a very responsible, hard-working person who would like to improve her quality of life and that of her family in order to triumph in life.  María lives with her husband and her five children in Riobamba.  

María works along with her husband in agriculture.  They plant artichokes in large quantities in order to sell them in the markets.  Currently due to the poor climate they need to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides in order to save their harvest.  If they don't the production will be damaged and they will have losses.  They also need to invest in the purchase of seeds and other products like corn and beans in order to increase their income and to pay the harvesters of the artichokes.  

María dreams of exporting her products to various countries and improving the quality of life of her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and fungicides and to pay the harvesters of artichokes.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda, 55 years old, is a widow. She has been a maize farmer for 30 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production: She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that, in the future, she can acquire machines like tractors to enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, where the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, Jean Bosco wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize grounds, where the borrower will still produce a harvest for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 52 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que le gusta salir adelante con su familia. Francisca vive con sus hijos en Riobamba.

Francisca se dedica a elaborar bloque y ladrillos desde hace mucho tiempo, este negocio lo amprendió de sus padres y este negocio es una fuente de ingresos importante para su familia. Francisca necesita invertir en la compra de una maquinaria elaboradora de bloques y ladrillos ya que actualmente la que tiene está en mal estado y demora su producción, con esta inversión optimizará tiempo y podrá cumplir sus pedidos a tiempo.

Francisca sueña en que sus hijos sigan con el negocio y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisca, 52, is a very hard-working and responsible person who likes to move forward with her family. Francisca lives with her children in Riobamba.

Francisca has made a living making blocks and bricks for a long time. She learned this business from her parents and it is an important source of income for her family.

Francisca needs to invest in the purchase of machinery to make blocks and bricks since the machinery she currently has is in disrepair and is delaying her production. With this investment she will be able to optimize her time and she can complete her orders on time.

Francisca dreams of her children continuing with the business and that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy new machinery for the fabrication of blocks and bricks since her current machinery is in disrepair and production is slow

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is from the small village of Baghdati district. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children (12 and 19 years old). The elder child is a student and the younger one goes to the local school. Lela’s mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. Specifically, they have a vineyard and do all the relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. They pick the grapes and produce wine and vodka. In addition, Lela runs a small dairy farm: she has 2 milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. Lela also owns a nut garden and a plot of land where maize is grown. Lela sells her agricultural products: cheese, nuts, maize, wine and vodka at the local market. She is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Lela has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan she plans to purchase additional milk cows.
