This will allow Lela to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and finance the education of her children. Lela awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is an energetic lady who is 34 years old. She has been in the business of milk sales for many years and has one buffalo to milk. She is a very hardworking lady and financially supports her husband in meeting their household expenses. She lives in a large conventional family with her husband, children, and their grandparents. Both Razia and her husband work hard to fulfill the needs of their family members. 

To meet her customers' demands and target more customers, Razia is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy one cow to increase her milk sales. She also wants to sell dairy products such as butter and cheese, which would enable her to earn more profit. She wishes to use part of her revenue to improve her family's and her well being. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy one cow to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, 47, is married to a surveyor and has three children between the ages of 7 and 22, all currently in school. She lives in Sinkor. For the past  three years, Beatrice has been selling dry meat (bush meat) in the market. She faces the challenge of transporting the meat from the interior to the market for sale. Beatrice uses the profit from her sales to buy more goods and to help with the family expenses. She is requesting her fifth loan  to purchase more dry meat for the business to increase her sales. Beatrice's future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tayyba's Group

texts.en:
Tayyaba is a 25-year old married woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan. She has 2 sons, 5 and 3 years old. For 25 years Tayyaba's husband has been running a beauty salon, which is the only source of income for her family. She also helps her husband in his business. 

Tayyaba as a member of a 3-person lending group and has requested for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's beauty salon. He needs to purchase furniture like chairs, sofas, tables for the business. With the profit, they will expand their business by opening a new beauty salon. She wishes to live in her own house, as they are currently living in a rented house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her husband's beauty salon.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is the father of three children aged between 10 and 13 years. He has been farming for more than ten years, producing and selling maize, bananas, milk and peas.

Silas has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy barbed wire for reinforcing a zero grazing unit and a chuff cutter to ease the feeding of the dairy animals. He adds that these will ease his farming activities. Silas says he chose Juhudi Kilimo for funding due to faster services.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and barbed wire

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is aged sixty two years and has been in a farming business. He is married and has seven children, two of whom are in schooling. His farm produce includes maize and milk, which he sells locally.

Christopher has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will boost his family's income. He aspires to grow his business and supply the regional markets. He adds that part of the milk income will ensure that he gets a better education for his children.

He mentions feed shortage and animal diseases as the main challenges in his business.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bernadetta

texts.en:
Bernadetta is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a tailoring retail shop where she sells trousers, skirts and trousers, bags, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a big viable slum market area and her primary customers are residents from the slum. 

Bernadetta describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of materials(fabric) used for making clothes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric for making clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale clothes retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith's group is comprised of  hard working women. Edith is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Edith has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, maize flour and dry beans. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like rice, beans and maize flour for resale. This will help Edith to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Edith hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like rice, beans and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 29 years old, from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married with one child, aged three years.

Philip has a transport business that he has been doing for the past three years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a pool table which he will operate besides the transport business, as another source of income.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a pool table.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 58 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 21 y 16 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en su propia que compro gracias a su esfuerzo de cada día. La actividad que realiza Octavia, es muy trabajoso pero ella dice: “que no hay nada difícil en la vida, con la finalidad de tener buena salud y un buen bienestar”; Octavia sabe las dificultades de trabajar en el campo y sobre todo para una mujer; es por eso que su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en los deberes. Hace 35 años que empezó a labrar la tierra; desde muy tempranas horas se dirigía a su chacra no importaba si hacia lluvia pero tenia que mantener sus plantas alejadas de las plagas que afectan. Por tal motivo acuden a MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo. Con el tiempo desea en incrementar con más plantas de café; porque sabe que son beneficiosos con las ventas y de esa manera obtener una estabilidad económica. Este es su crédito número 06, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está seguro que con su grupo comunal llegara muy lejos, ya que le trae muchos beneficios. Con los 500 nuevos soles, le dará un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café respectivamente, para ello comprara insumos y abonos de primera calidad.
texts.en: Octavia is 58 years old, is married and has two children ages 21 and 16 respectively.  Together they live in their own home which she purchased thanks to her hard work every day.  Octavia is very hard-working and she says: "there is nothing difficult in life, as long as you have good health and a good attitude." Octavia knows the challenges of working in the fields, particularly for a woman.  For that reason her husband and her children help her with her work.  She began working in the fields 35 years ago.  From very early in the morning she would go out to her field regardless of rain because she had to maintain her plants and keep them from disease.  For this reason she is asking MFP for a loan in order to help with her work plans.  With time she wants to increase her coffee plants because she knows sales are good and in that way she can obtain a stable income.  This is her 6th credit with MFP, and she therefore promises to continue meeting her payments.  In addition, she feels certain that with her communal bank she will go far, since the group offers many benefits.  With 500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will be able to give adequate nutrients to her coffee plants, and to do so she will buy fertilizers and nutrients of high quality.

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladis Jeanethe

texts.es:
La señora Gladis de 37 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su madre en su casa en donde tiene una pulpería, en donde vende pollo, frescos, granos básicos, y productos lácteos, su venta es con sus clientes vecinos, y amigos que a diario visitan su negocio. Ella radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, Doña Gladis es una mujer que ha luchado sola y desea salir adelante con su negocio.
Doña Gladis esta solicitando el prestado para comprar pollo, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, frijoles, maíz, aceite, manteca, detergente, jabón, papel higiénico, pan, huevos, etc. de esa manera surtir un poco su negocio, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella mejorara su negocio y sus utilidades serán mejor de esa manera saldrá adelante con sus proyectos.
Doña Gladis su deseo es tener un buen negocio.
SAN LORENZO, HONDURAS - Septiembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladis is 37 years old and unmarried. She does not have dependent children and lives with her mother in her home where she has a small store selling chicken, soft drinks, basic grains and milk products. She sells to customers who are neighbors and friends and who come to her store every day. She lives in the town of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. Doña Gladis is a woman who has struggled alone and who wants her business to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, meat, milk products, canned goods, beans, corn, oil, butter, detergent, soap, toilet paper, bread, eggs, etc. so she can stock her business. With support from this loan she will improve her business and its profits will increase so that she can move ahead with her projects. Her dream is to have a good business.

SAN LORENZO, HONDURAS – September,  2012.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, milk products, canned goods, beans, corn, oil, butter, detergent, soap, toilet paper, bread, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been in farming for seven years, within his rural home area, where he produces milk and eggs. He is married and has five children, two of whom are in schooling.

Andrew has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says that this will be his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. His first loan was for 31,200 KES. He adds that the experience he has earned for the business will help him with loan management.

He, however, notes that the major challenge in his business is lack of capital among smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 48 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have six children. She has been a maize farmer for 19 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business. In the future, she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, where the borrower will still produce maize for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 47 years old, married and has three children. He sells bones, which are later recycled into beads, for making jewellery and ornaments. He has been in this business for three years. He also does livestock farming to earn extra income.

Justus hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested for 40,000 KES to buy bones for recycling.

loans.use: to buy bones.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 53 years old. She is a widow with six children between the ages of 14 and 25. She has been a maize farmer for 16 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines (such as tractors) that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from the village of Nergeti, Baghdati district. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband and 20-year-old son. Nani and her husband are provided with a retirement pension.

The family is involved in the agricultural business. They have a nut garden and do all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. In addition, Nani runs a small dairy farm; she has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. The family also owns bee hives with bee colonies. Nani sells cheese, honey and nuts in her village. She is a very hardworking woman, with rich experience in her work. Nani has applied for this loan to increase her number of cattle by purchasing an additional milk cow. This will allow Nani to receive more milk for her dairy and increase her sales, which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions. Nani awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms Sakina is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband has a cycle repair shop. Sakina has supported her family financially by selling milk for many years and serves her community well. She has two buffalo and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Sakina looks after the buffalo and collects their milk and her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They happily do it together to support their family.

Sakina is also responsible for fulfilling her children's needs for food and clothing. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures. In order to make larger profits, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to gain more customers. Sakina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo to gain more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 46 años, es una mujer amable, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos; a quien desea una mejor calidad de vida. Marina, es una mujer de trabajo, le gusta la vida del campo, hace 16 años empezó a laborar cultivando plantas café, que con gran esfuerzo ah logrado obtener. En tiempos de cosecha normalmente pide el apoyo de los jornaleros para que puedan extraer de manera fácil sus frutos, Marina, considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con las plagas que afectan la producción de sus plantas. Por ello desde que se entero sobre los préstamos que MFP realizaba pues no dudo en acercarse para consultar con su asesor; ahora gracias al apoyo puede cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. Este es su crédito número 03, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además respalda a su grupo comunal por la buena organización que tienen.
Con los 500 nuevos soles, le servirá para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a su producto como el café, comprando abono natural.
texts.en: Marina is 46 years old and is a friendly lady. She lives in her own house together with her 4 lovely children, for whom she wants the best quality of life. Marina is a hard-working woman and she likes the country lifestyle. Sixteen years ago she started working in the cultivation of coffee plants, which she obtained with a lot of hard work. During the harvest she usually requires the help of day-workers so that they can easily pick the fruits. For Marina, the most difficult thing is when she is unable to fight the plagues which affect her coffee production. For this reason she found out about MFP loans, and she did not hesitate in approaching a consultant. Now, thanks to the support she can carry out her planned work. This is her third credit, and she promises to make her repayments punctually. She supports her communal bank for its good organization. She will use the 500 nuevos soles to maintain her produce such as her coffee plants with the purchase of natural fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy a bag of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She has a fruit and vegetable business where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. 

This is the third loan that she has requested from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she needs to buy a greater amount of fruit and vegetables. At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to increase her sales because she buys in small quantities on a daily basis. Her goal is to have a grocery store in her own home. She will be helped by her husband. This will give her higher income so that she can keep improving the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: José De Los Santos

texts.es: Jose es un hombre de 60 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de libros desde hace 31; con su negocio ha generado ingresos para sostener los gastos de su familia, hoy  conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 36 años. Su negocio  consiste en la venta de libros técnicos, enciclopedias, entre otros de interés general. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y algunas veces a crédito, lo hace de manera directa en su sitio de trabajo.  Sus principales clientes son profesores y estudiantes, que lo visitan,  para encargarle los libros que requieren en su educación profesional  y José muchas veces no tiene la capacidad de responderles de manera inmediata,  a la creciente demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará libros que venderá en su punto de ventas ubicado en una prestigiosa universidad de la ciudad.  José desarrolla muchas estrategias de ventas para impulsar sus libros, como los remates de libros usados que compra a muy bajo precio a los mismos estudiantes que terminan cada semestre y él los vuele a vender a los que ingresan a nuevos semestres en la universidad. Todo el aprendizaje de la venta de libros se lo debe a un amigo, que algún día pidió el favor a José de comprar libros para surtir su negocio, pero José fue engañado y debió quedarse trabajando en el negocio por solicitud de su amigo. Allí tomó la mejor experiencia y hoy ha progresado con su actividad; hoy  tiene como meta ampliar su infraestructura de negocios, vendiendo libros especializados y comprando directamente a las casas editoras, para genera mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
José, 60, has made a living selling books for the last 31 years. With his business, he has generated enough income to keep up with the expenses of his family, which today is composed of his wife and three children, aged between 12 and 36. 

His business consists of the sale of technical books, encyclopedias, and other books of general interest. His sales are conducted in cash and sometimes credit, done directly at his workplace. His principal clients are professors and students who come to him to order the books required for their professional educations. José many times does not have the ability to respond to them immediately due to growing demand. 

This is the reason for which he is looking to a Credikiva loan, the first financing he will do through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy books to be sold in his sales site located in a prestigious university in the city. José has developed many sales strategies to boost his book sales, such as used book auctions. He purchases the used books at very low prices from the students themselves when they finish each semester, and resells them to those beginning the semester. 

He owes everything he has learned about book sales to a friend of his, who one day asked José the favor of buying books to stock up his business, but José was tricked and had to remain working in the business at the request of his friend. That was the best experience, and today he has progressed with this activity. Today he has the goal of expanding his business infrastructure, selling specialized books and purchasing directly from publishers in order to generate higher profitability.

loans.use: to buy books

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 36 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has also been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and purchase of fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He will invest his profits from farming in his business so that he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.


The photo taken was at last season's maize ground, which the borrower will use for the new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor cost during maize production.

loans.name: Naomi V.

texts.en:
Naomi, 49 years old, lives in the Gbarnga area. She is married and has 4 children aged 11 to 27, two of whom live at home and attend school. For the past two years, Naomi has been running a drugstore (pharmacy) in the community. She has requested this loan to purchase more blood tonic, paracetamol, cough syrup, etc. in order to have sufficient drugs in her pharmacy.

Naomi's main problems are that her customers sometimes take items on credit and don’t pay and sometimes she has to help her neighbors with treatment for free. She started this business by selling cool water in wheelbarrows and learned this from friends. She likes this business because she makes new friends and meets people each and every day. It makes her proud to have money in her pocket every day. In the future, Naomi wants to open another shop near the present one.

loans.use: to purchase more blood tonic, paracetamol, cough syrup, etc.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a 25 year old single man. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has owned this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are residents from nearby. His biggest business challenge is the lack of an enclosed business premise.  Changes in the weather, especially during rainy and sunny days, negatively affect his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. His business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years. In the future, he hopes to be more financially stable. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Morie

texts.en: Morie is 24 years old, single and lives in Sinkor, Liberia. She has a child who is 1 year old and is attending school. For the past four years she has been selling cooking oil, tomatoes, sardines, washing soap, bath soap and many other items in the market. She is proud of her business because it makes her feel independent. She makes a profit with her sales. With that profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, tomatoes, cooking oil, and bath soap for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, tomatoes, cooking oil, and bath soap  for the business

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is married and has 5 children. She describes herself as devoted to her business. Roda operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks such as bread, doughnuts and cakes. Her business is located in a potential business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. Roda describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell. Roda's business goal is to run a big hotel  within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will renovate her restaurant to attract customers to the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 43 years old, is from Ndunyu-Njeru. She is married and has three children aged between 22 and 3 years old. Jane has been farming for the past 14 years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to buy a hybrid dairy cow to add to her livestock. Jane hopes to own four hybrid dairy cows in the near future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon, 36 years old, is married and has two children. He sells cakes, biscuits, cooking fat and maize flour to earn a living. Simon does not have a permanent business premise but he uses his bicycle to distribute his items. He also farms to earn extra income. Simon hopes to own a permanent business premise in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cakes, biscuits, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy cakes, biscuits, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys, 35 years old, is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 7 years. Aloys will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production and to support labor costs during maize production. He will use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines such as tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

This photo was taken at the previous maize ground, which Aloys will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 46 years old and lives in Saclepea; he is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 16, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past seventeen years, he has been involved in the sale of fashion clothes. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more jeans, trousers, T-shirts, shirts, and jerseys for his business. The problem he’s faced with is the rainy season because he does not have a good shop. He started this business by helping his father.  What he likes about this business is that it helped him with his family and makes him popular—the way he exchanges money with others makes him proud. In the future he wants to build a good shop and have more stock in it.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, trousers, T-shirts, shirts, and jerseys for his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson has a shoe sales business in Nakuru and has been in the business for three years. He is 37 years old and married to Jane.

This will be his third loan, and he plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of shoes to sell in his business, especially as we approach the festive season. He will use the anticipated income to open a shoe stall and sell more varieties of shoes.

In the future Benson hopes to grow his business by supplying shoes to various traders in Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Diana Margarita

texts.es: Diana con su anterior credikiva compró refrescos y cervezas en mayor volumen y los vendió oportunamente, ampliando su negocio porque mejoró el surtido.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito con el cual comprará materiales de construcción para hacer adecuaciones locativas a sus instalaciones  y comprar en mayor volumen cervezas y refrescos con el resto de dinero. Su negocio aumenta su potencial de ventas, porque su ubicación estratégica, frente a un campo de futbol,  hace que roten diariamente muchos clientes y en especial los fines de semana, en los que practican deportes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el apoyo, estoy muy agradecida para trabajar y salir adelante”.
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Diana purchased soft drinks and beer in greater quantities and sold them opportunely, expanding her business because she improved her stock.  Currently, she is requesting a new loan with which she will purchase construction materials to make improvements to her business and to buy greater quantities of beer and soft drinks with the rest of the money.  Her potential sales are increased because of her strategic location next to a soccer field, where many customers pass through daily, and especially on the weekends when many play sports.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  "Thank you for the support.  I am very grateful to work hard and get ahead."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements to her business  and to buy beer and soft drinks with the rest of the money.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single beautiful lady who lives with her parents. 

She has a business selling firewood from home, selling to the neighborhood. Her primary customers are fish sellers and hotel operators.  She was able to set up her business with a bit of money she had saved up, through a merry-go-round.

She is a very determined and honest person, well-known and liked by everyone who lives in that neighborhood.

She is applying for a loan to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 43 years old.  He is married, with one child.

He is a tailor, and he has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of KES 7,000 from his business.

This his first term loan in KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers.  He will use the loan amount to purchase clothing material for use in his business.

He hopes to expand his business by starting a tailoring college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material for use in his business.

loans.name: Fellows Group

texts.en:
Fellows group is made up of 5 women between the ages of 33 and 53, who sell rice, yams, vegetables, provisions, pomade, kitchen utensils, fish and cooking oil. Three are married with children, and two are single. 

Augusta is a 53-year-old single woman who sells rice, yams, and vegetables. She has been doing this work for 9 years and is in her 5th loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Her 4th loan amount was 800 Ghana, which was used to buy items and sell to customers. She now needs 900 Ghana cedis to invest in the business so that she can increase stock to meet customer demands. She will build her own house in the future. She also invests all her profits back into the business.

They need 2900 Ghana cedis to be able to expand businesses.

loans.use: to buy more rice, yams, and vegetables to supply to customers.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is 26 years old and single. She has been a maize farmer for 3 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines (such as tractors) that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 35 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for eight years. He will use Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertiliser and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a shaving machine to boost his business

loans.name: Brushirah's Group

texts.en:
Brushirah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Brushirah has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food like matooke. 

To help expand her business, Brushirah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like matooke, maize, and charcoal for resale.  It will help Brushirah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers. Brushirah hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her business by adding more different types of food. 

Brushirah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like matooke, maize, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es un agricultor de la zona de Huatusco, Ver. Cuenta con 56 años de edad vive en casa propia y es soltero, cultiva café desde hace ya mucho tiempo pues desde niño su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con el oficio, es productor de café orgánico el cual vende a la Unión Regional de Huatusco. Miguel también trabaja por temporadas como jornalero con otras personas para así tener un ingreso extra. Para Miguel sus padres son lo más importante. Lo que mas quiere es ayudarlos a salir adelante. Por lo cual ha decidido pedir un crédito para mejorar su finca de café con la compra de fertilizantes, compra de plantas para renovación y para el pago de labores culturales de manera que con ello se pueda obtener una buena cosecha que hará posible que mejore sus ingresos así como también su calidad de vida. A él le gustaría pasando la cosecha remodelar su casa para que sus padres vivan más cómodamente.
texts.en: Miguel is a farmer in the Huatusco, Veracruz area. He is 56 years old. He lives in his own house and is single. He has grown coffee for quite a long time, since from childhood his father taught him everything about this work. He produces organic coffee that he sells to the regional union of Huatusco. Miguel also works seasonally as a day laborer with other people to thus have an extra income. For Miguel, his parents are the most important thing. What he most wants is to help them advance. For this reason, he has decided to apply for a loan to improve his coffee farm with the purchase of fertilizers, to buy plants for renovation, and to pay for labor to care for the plants so that he can obtain a good harvest that will make it possible to improve his income as well as his quality of life. After the harvest, he would like to remodel his house so that his parents can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilize his farm

loans.name: Darwin Felix

texts.es:
Darwin es un joven de 21 años, tuvo la oportunidad de terminar la escuela primaria, vive con su padre Segundo, quien es albañil y tiene 57 años. Viven en el Barrio Boliche de la ciudad de Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Latacunga es una acogedora ciudad que atrae a sus turistas por sus estrechas calles decoradas con coloniales calles e iglesias arquitectónicas que conservan la típica fachada de años atrás.
Darwin fabrica bloques de cemento que sirven como ladrillos para la construcción de viviendas, aprendió esta actividad desde muy niño guiado por sus hermanos mayores, ahora ya son 3 años en los cuales Darwin se ha dedicado a trabajar en este negocio en el cual invierte 8 horas cada día sin recibir ayuda. Esta actividad es muy promovida en la ciudad y en la provincia en general por lo que la competencia cada vez es más fuerte, sin embargo Darwin ha decidido incrementar su producción para mejorar sus ingresos, para lo cual se informó sobre instituciones que apoyen a jóvenes emprendedores y solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa, en donde aparte de brindarle la ayuda económica, le asesoran para que su negocio salga adelante. Darwin espera que su negocio sea conocido por los grandes compradores de bloques y así él pueda  cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Darwin is a young man of 21 who had the opportunity to get through elementary school and lives with his father, Segundo, who is a  57-year-old brick mason. They live in the Boliche neighborhood of the city of Latacunga, capital of the Cotopaxi province, which is part of the Andes region of Ecuador. Cotopaxi has developed to such a remarkable extent in recent years that it has become known as one of the most important provinces of the whole region thanks to its floral, mining, metalworking, agricultural, and cattle industries. What's more, there are many businesses investing their growing profits back into this commercial city and offering many opportunities to get ahead. Latacunga is a charming city that attracts tourists with its narrow colonial streets and architecturally interesting churches that preserve their facades of years past. 

Darwin makes cement blocks that are used as bricks for constructing houses. He learned this trade very young, led by his older brothers. Now, Darwin has been in this trade for 3 years, spending 8 hours every day without help. This line of business is very active in the city and the province generally, so the competition is increasingly strong. Nonetheless, Darwin has decided to increase his capacity so he can earn a higher income. That's how he came to learn about financial institutions that help young entrepreneurs and requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa [Kiva field partner], which, in addition to providing financial support, also offers advice on how to improve his business. Darwin hopes that his business will come to be known as one of the big cinderblock suppliers so he can realize his dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase the capacity of his business.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is 41 years old and has six children. She and her husband live with them in the town of Likoni, Mombasa. Biasha has her own business selling fish. She has a location in one of the busy areas of the market. She tells us that she is well known since she has been in this business for over 10 years and her customers call her mama samaki (mother who sells fish). This experience has earned good profits for her from her ever-increasing customers. 

The loan she is requesting now is her fourth one and is for 30,000 KES. The money will be used to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil so she can increase her earnings. Biasha’s dream is to have a strong business that will generate income so that she can cover her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 37, is from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married with three children who are between the ages of 8 and 14.

Stephen is a cobbler and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy leather which he can use to make shoes for sale.

He hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin de 52 años de edad tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familiar, en pequeñas proporciones que su clientela puede comprar. El y su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 25 años, vive al suroccidente de la ciudad, en un barrio que poco a poco sale de la informalidad de sus habitantes, quienes son principalmente trabajadores independientes, con grandes sueños de salir adelante, mediante la educación de su familia.  En la actualidad necesita surtir su negocio porque la demanda de los artículos que ofrece crece cada día más y sus inventarios no resisten tanta solicitud, por su insuficiente capital de trabajo para responderles y hacer que su negocio crezca. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará víveres, bebidas y cárnicos, para obtener descuentos y aumentar sus ingresos. En su negocio Benjamín realiza las ventas de contado y se desempeña en su labor comercial, de lunes a domingos, con pocos descansos; las compras las realiza a crédito y de contado a distribuidores de sus productos, que le hacen buenas ofertas y le ofrecen oportunidades de acceso a artículos, con descuentos y a créditos. Su meta mas adelante es hacer reparaciones locativas a su negocio, porque él esta esmerado en hacerle a sus clientes un ambiente confortable, cuando le van a comprar  y finalmente tener una casa propia,  lo cual es muy seguramente uno de sus grandes desafíos.
texts.en:
Benjamin, 52, owns a store where he sells snack food, supplies, soft drinks, and general household items in small amounts that his customers can afford. He and his family, made up of his partner and their 4 children, ages 13 to 25, live in the southwest of the city in a neighborhood that is slowly but surely emerging from the informal economy of its residents, who are mostly independent workers with big dreams of getting ahead through their families' education. 

Currently, he needs to stock up his store because what he offers is in more and more demand every day and his inventory can't keep up with that pace due to a lack of the working capital he needs to make his business grow. That's exactly the reason that he's gotten involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner] to request a Kiva loan, his first from this organization, with which he will buy home supplies, beverages, and meats in bulk so as to receive discounts and increase his earnings. 

At work, Benjamin is busy manning the cash register and attending to his business from Monday to Sunday with few breaks. He makes his purchases on credit and in cash from suppliers that can offer him deals and opportunities to buy items at a discount. His most pressing goals are to make certain repairs to his business, as he's focussed on providing a comfortable environment for his customers when they come in to shop and, ultimately, to have his own home, which is definitely one of his main struggles.

loans.use: to buy home supplies, beverages, and meats for sale.

loans.name: Kimberly Stefania

texts.es:
Kimberly comenzó hace 2 años trabajando en un cyber, pero con un préstamo familiar decidió establecer su propio negocio. En la actualidad posee un cyber con muy buena clientela, ya que está ubicado cerca de la Plaza cívica del Cantón Playas. Trabaja en su cyber desde las 8:00 de la mañana, sale al almuerzo una hora y regresar a trabajar hasta la 7:00pm. 

Unas de sus dificultades es un poco la delincuencia de la zona en la que se encuentra ubicado el cyber, pero ya puso puerto eléctrico con rejas para evitar que le roben. 

Kimberly está  separada tiene 1 hijo pequeño que aun no estudia. Con  el préstamo va a comprar recargas celulares, papelería y una impresora. Unas de sus aspiraciones es tener una casa cómoda para su hijo pequeño, seguir creciendo en su negocio. hasta tener una sucursal en  Posorja.
texts.en: Kimberly began working two years ago at a cyber cafe, and with a loan from a family member she started her one business. Now she runs her own cyber cafe which has a strong clientele because her business is located next to the Civic Square in the Playas neighborhood. She works from 8:00 in the morning, has a one our lunch break, and then returns to work until 7:00 pm. One of her difficulties is there is some crime in her neighborhood. However, she has installed an electric door with bars to protect her business from potential robbers. Kimberly is separated and has a young son who is not yet school age. With the loan she will buy credit to recharge cell phones as well as purchase a printer and stationary. Her goal is to have a comfortable house for her son and to continue growing her business until she can have a branch in the town of Posorja.

loans.use: buy a printer and stationary and purchase credit to recharge cell phones

loans.name: Concessa

texts.en:
Concessa is a widow, aged 67. She has been a maize farmer for 40 years. She plans to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the borrower will continue to use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is impacted by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Aurora E Jesus

texts.es: "Gracias por prestarme y apoyarme", son fraces que Aurora envia a sus financiadores de Kiva, pues con su anterior financiamiento logró, comprar calzado y muchos productos de belleza que vendió y ganó dinero. Hoy está aspirando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de aseo, calzado de marcas costosas, pues se prepara para el fin de año, época en la cual desde ya, sus clientes han solicitado mercancias que solo en esta oortunidad pueden comprar, porque es una temporada en las que reciben sus primas y bonificaciones y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión logre el éxito esperado.
texts.en: "Thank you for lending to me and helping me" is the message that Aurora sends to her Kiva lenders, as she has previously succeeded in buying shoes and many beauty products that she was able to sell and earn income from with her last loan. Now, she's hoping for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy personal hygiene products and brand-name shoes, as she prepares for the end of the year. This is the season when in the past her customers have been looking for merchandise that they can only buy at the time because it's when they get their bonuses and advances. That's also exactly what makes her investment pay off as expected.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products and brand-name shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Forjadores De La Vida Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Forjadores de la Vida” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de plantas, costuras, venta de manteles, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Mónica integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco y pantalón de color lila, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño., en sus piernas lleva su cartera de color negro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ensaladas surtidas, desde hace 12 años. Comenta que trabaja los miércoles y sábado, en las calles y otras veces en las ferias, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la vega (abundante comercio de productos del campo) donde encuentra sus verduras frescas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará aceitunas, repollo, lechugas, zanahorias para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Monica es crecer y llegar a tener un local para ofrecer su mercadería, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Monica vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos quienes dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando y el mayor trabajando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local, y a nivel familiar tener su casa propia ya que vive de allegada en el terreno de madre.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
 Respecto a la s capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en: The "Forjardores de La Vida" community bank consists of 17 enterprising women who make a living in different trades, among which: selling at flea markets, selling vegetables, selling fruits, selling plants, sewing, selling table clothes, and other services. All of the members are from the city of Concepción, Chile. Mónica, a group member who is seated in the photo fourth from the right in the front row with a lilac jumpsuit, has made a living selling assorted salads for the past 12 years. She says she works Wednesdays and Saturdays, selling in the streets and other times at flea markets, her schedule depending on availability. She buys her merchandise and supplies at the commercial center where farmers bring in their products, where she finds fresh vegetables at low costs, which is financially beneficial. With the loan, she plans to purchase olives, cabbage, lettuce and carrots to stock her business. One of Mónica's goals is for her business to grow and to have a store where she can offer her products so she can generate more income and thus improve her quality of life. Mónica lives with her husband and their three children, two of whom are in school and the oldest of whom is working. Her dream for work is having her own store, and her familial dream is to have her own home since they live on her mother's land. She is very content and grateful for the opportunity provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, which has allowed her to invest in her business. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the fellow members of her community bank, because the different activities and interests serve as a welcomed distraction. In respect to the training she has received at the group meetings, she has learned to better administer her business. Concepción is seated at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile in the region of Biobío. It has played an important role in the nation's history, being sight of important battles and treaties, especially during the Arauco War (a long-running conflict between colonial Spaniards and the Mapuche people). Currently the city is undergoing an important economic and demographic development to come to be considered one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to purchase olives, cabbage, lettuce and carrots to stock her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Manuel, soy un costarricense de 42 años de edad, vivo en la provincia de Heredia,  padre de dos adolescentes, trabajo independiente como electricista, he formado mi propia empresa, poco a poco he ido aumentando mi clientela, pero necesito equipo de trabajo ( herramientas para electricista) con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, estoy solicitando quinientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 550.000) , con este préstamo compraré una máquina para soldar y otras herramientas que necesito para realizar mi trabajo con calidad y eficiencia.
Con mi ingreso económico llevo el sustento a mi hogar y pago la educación de mis hijos, mi sueño es ver crecer mi empresa y beneficiar a otros con empleo . Estoy muy agradecido con Dios por esta oportunidad de crédito rápido y sin requisitos difíciles de cumplir.
texts.en:
My name is Manuel, and I'm a 42 year old Costa Rican. I live in the province of Heredia, and have two teenage children. I work as an independent electrician. I have formed my own company and little by little have grown my client base, but I need electrian's tools in order to provide my clients with better service. I am applying for a loan of 550,000 colones; with this loan I will buy a soldering machine and other tools that I need to do efficient and high quality work. 

With my income I provide for my family and pay for my children's education. My dream is to grow my business and be able to employ other people. I am very thankful to God for this loan opportunity because it is fast and its terms are not difficult to fulfill.

loans.use: purchase a soldering machine and other tools for electricians

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 28-year-old married woman with four family members from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. In the future, she wants to improve her living standard. 

Since Hanan is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: James Gathii

texts.en:
James used his previous loan amount to buy fuel to sell in his business. It was profitable and he paid the loan amount in good time.

This will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy more stock of diesel to sell in his business. Since demand is high, he anticipates to make more income with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

James hopes to open a large petrol station in the area and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to sell

loans.name: Eilsa

texts.es: Edilsa de 22 años de edad es la propietaria de una miscelánea, que nació por su mucha inclinación hacia los negocios desde muy niña y hoy lo hace para beneficiar el bienestar de su familia,  especialmente de sus 2 hijos, en las edades de 5 y 7 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en adultos  muy exitosas. Su negocio nació desde hace 6 años y es un punto comercial o miscelánea, donde vende al detalle muchos artículos, como accesorios femeninos, para el hogar, perfumería, papelería entre otros. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, mientras sus compras las hace en almacenes y cacharrerías que le venden en mayores cantidades y logra obtener descuentos cuando aplica un mayor volumen. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector donde está ubicada, quienes satisfacen sus necesidades de compra en el negocio de Edilsa,  sin tener que trasladarse a los centros comerciales,  incurriendo en gastos. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su estructura locativa y tener la oportunidad de darle una casa propia a sus hijos, quienes son la razón de su trabajo esforzado y persistente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina, una nevera, para vender helados y mercancía, alusiva a la fecha de amor y amistad, temporada en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y gana un poco mas.
texts.en: Eilsa is 22 years old and is the proprietor of a variety store, which arose from the strong inclination toward business that she has had since she was a child and which she now runs to benefit the well-being of her family, especially her two children, ages 5 and 7, whom she dreams of seeing become very successful adults. Her business began 6 years ago, and it is a sales point or variety store where she sells many retail items, such as feminine accessories, items for the home, perfume, and paper goods, among other items. She makes her sales on credit or for cash, while she makes her purchases in warehouses and china shops which sell to her in larger quantities and where she is able to obtain discounts when she buys a larger volume. Her principal clients are the neighbors in the district where she is located, who satisfy their shopping needs in Eilsa's business without having to travel to the commercial centers, incurring expenses. Her goal for the future is to expand her retail structure and have the opportunity to provide her children, who are the reason for her dedicated and persistent work, with their own home. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy a display case and a refrigerator to sell ice cream and merchandise for the day of love and friendship [February 14], a season in which she increases her sales and earns a little more.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and a refrigerator to sell ice cream and seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Soy una joven estudiante, me llamo Evelyn , ayudo a mi familia con los gastos del hogar  y por medio de las ventas por catálogo logro estudiar en horarios nocturnos , necesito tener más clientes, ya que mi meta es estudiar hasta convertirme en una profesional, estoy solicitando un crédito por un millón treinta y cinco mil colones  (¢1.035.000)  para comprar una cantidad mayor de mercadería y abarcar más localidades con lo cual aumentaré mi clientela y por consiguiente mis ingresos, agradezco la oportunidad de financiamiento por parte de este programa de crédito local.
texts.en: I am a young student. My name is Evelyn. I help my family with household expenses, and through selling items via catalog I am able to go to night school. I need to have more customers, since my goal is to study until I make myself into a professional. I'm requesting the loan to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise and to cover more ground, which will increase my clientele and my income. I am thankful for this financial opportunity through this local loan program.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to resell.

loans.name: Imedal

texts.en:
Imedal is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has children. For the past two years, Imedal has been working hard to manage her tailoring business.  

To help expand her business, Imedal has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for making clothes for resale, and will help Imedal to generate greater profits and improve the capital in her shop. Imedal hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her business by having different fashion styles of clothes for customers. 

Imedal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta compró mercancías variadas,  mediante guías especializadas, como perfumes, colonias, cremas. Productos capilares, y cosméticos femeninos. Su credikiva anterior la ayudó a aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ello impulsó sus ventas,  y sus utilidades se incrementaron. En la actualidad está muy satisfecha y está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará perfumes, colonias y cosméticos femeninos, productos de mayor rotación en su inventario. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco sinceramente la ayuda recibida y deseo que la vida les premien tanta generosidad”
texts.en: Julieta purchases and sells various merchandise from special catalogues, including perfumes, colognes, creams, hair products, and women’s cosmetics.  Her previous Kiva loan helped her increase her working capital, which allowed her to boost her sales and increase her profits.  She is very pleased with the results, and is currently applying for a new loan that she will use to purchase perfumes, colognes, and women’s cosmetics, which are the products in her inventory with the highest turnover.  Julieta has the following message to Kiva lenders: “I am very grateful for the help you have given me and I hope that all of your generosity will be rewarded.”

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, and women’s cosmetics.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy materials to make sandal soles. Lang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as synthetic rubber

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 42 years old. She is married to a driver. She has been a maize farmer for 24 years. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for her maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at an older maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en: Jovans is married with six children; five of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her parents). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.  Jovans works seven days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow so that she becomes a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is 49 years old. She is described as a hardworking woman who is very cheerful and really wants to get ahead. Sikukuu sells juice and ice cream both from her home and at a nearby school. Seeing that her business is growing every day, she has decided to take out a Yehu loan, which will be invested in buying flavoring, fresh water, plastic bags, and other necessary items needed to make her juice and ice cream. This will help her obtain better production of the products she sells and better income for her family.

Sikukuu dreams of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy flavoring, fresh water, plastic bags, and other necessary items to make juice and ice cream

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, de 19 años, es un joven alegre y trabajador; se esmera por salir adelante para poder tener un buen futuro; vive solo en su propia casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia. Los padres del joven William, le enseñaron todo sobre lo que es trabajar en la chacra, es por ello que desde hace 10 años empezó a ganar su propio dinero laborando en los campos de cultivo de sus vecinos quienes le agradecen la ayuda de William; ahora se dedica a los cuidados de sus propias plantas de café, quien con mucho esmero logró obtener. Con el tiempo desea tener varias hectáreas con plantaciones de café y de esa forma lograr tener una buena estadía. Por tal motivo acude a las financieras de MFP, para requerir un préstamo que ayude sus planes de trabajo y en un futuro logre cumplir sus sueños. Este es su crédito número 02, esta dispuesto a ser puntual con los pagos para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal es muy querido por sus compañeros por ser un joven muy responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono natural para hacer el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
William, 19, is a happy and hardworking young man who is making something of himself so he can have a better future. He lives alone in his own house that his parents left to him as inheritance. When he was young, William's parents taught him all about what it means to work on the farm and that's how he started earning his own money 10 years ago in his neighbors' fields who have been thankful for his help. Now he's focussed on his own coffee crops, which he was able to acquire through a lot of effort.   

In time, he hopes to have several hectares planted in coffee and that way succeed in having a good homestead. That's the what led him to seek out financing from Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner] and request a loan to help in his work plan and eventually realize his dreams. This will be his second credit and he's used to being punctual with his payments so that he may have access to future loans when he needs them. In his community bank he's much loved by those that know him for being such a responsible young man. WIth the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy organic fertilizer to use in caring for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Mi nombre es Nubia, vivo en una zona rural de Costa Rica llamada Upala, me dedico a la ganadería, específicamente a la producción de alimentos derivados de la leche, como natilla, queso, cuajada y otros, los cuales vendo a los vecinos de mi localidad y en algunos negocios cercanos. Necesito comprar dos vacas para producir más leche y por consiguiente fabricar más productos y aumentar mis ingresos, de los cuales depende mi familia, estoy solicitando cuatrocientos mil colones (¢400.000) para lograr  mi objetivo,  me siento muy feliz de contar con esta oportunidad de financiamiento local, en buena hora!
texts.en: My name is Nubia. I live in a rural area of Costa Rica called Upala. I make a living in livestock, specifically in the production of dairy products like custards, cheese, curds and other items, which I sell to my neighbors and to some nearby businesses. I need to buy two milk-cows to produce more milk and thus have more products to sell and increase my income, upon which my family depends. I am requesting the loan to achieve this objective. I feel very happy about having this local loan opportunity, and at a good time!

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
Soy Indira de Costa Rica, vivo en la provincia de Alajuela, trabajo en una empresa que se encuentra ubicada a unos 12 kilómetros de mi casa y he considerado comprar una motocicleta ya que soy madre de una niña y necesito estar de regreso temprano en mi casa, viajando en motocicleta gano tiempo y puedo disfrutar más a mi hija
Estoy solicitando quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para poder comprarla, Agradezco  la oportunidad que me dan de obtener crédito rápido y oportuno por medio de este proyecto, mi hija y yo lo agradecemos!
texts.en: I am Indira from Costa Rica. I live in the province of Alajuela. I work at a company located some 12 kilometers from my home, and I have considered purchasing a motorcycle since I have a daughter and I need to be home earlier. I will save time traveling on a motorcycle and can enjoy more time with my daughter. I am requesting the loan so I can make the purchase. I appreciate the opportunity to get a loan quickly and timely for this project. My daughter and I are thankful for it!

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity of beverages and rices to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of beverages and rices

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 51 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 24 years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous maize ground, which the Innocent will continue to use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is requesting another loan to buy a range of new beverage products in order to stock her store.  This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer the customers a greater variety of products.  Xuyen hopes that this new loan will assist her with increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and also helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her cafe, increasing her sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo de 50 años de edad es un hombre casado que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 28 años y vive al sur de la ciudad donde tiene su propio negocio y ofrece servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas, además de comercializa repuestos para vehículos; él desde muy joven se dedicó a la mecánica de motocicletas, porque le ha gustado siempre este oficio, el cual convirtió posteriormente en su principal actividad  generadora de ingresos. Su experiencia de 27 años,  hace que Rodolfo sea muy reconocido entre su clientela, ubicada alrededor se su barrio y en general son conductores de motocicletas o propietarios que se aceran a su negocio a comprarle, porque allí encuentran un servicio completo y de calidad.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos, bujías, neumáticos y partes eléctricas;  con esta inversión  proyecta incrementar sus ventas y así mismo generar mas utilidades con este nuevo capital de trabajo, el que mueve diariamente con sus ventas, impulsadas desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un almacén en un sitio mucho mas estratégico y en un ambiente confortable, para lograr impactar a su clientela y sentirse mas cómodo en su tarea diaria.
texts.en: Rodolfo, 50, is a married man that has three children ages ranging from 16-28 and lives in the South part of the city where he has his own business and offers the services of repair and maintenance of motorbikes, he also sells spare parts for cars; since he was young he started working in the mechanics of motorbikes because he's always liked this trade that later became his principal activity to generate income.  He has 27 years of experience that is recognized by his customers, who live in the surrounding neighborhood and are drivers or owners that come to his business because they know they can get full quality service.  He is now requesting a loan to Kiva, first credit through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy spare parts, spark plugs, tires and electric cords; with this investment he projects an increase in sales and thus more profits as a result of this new working capital, used daily through sales resulting from work that starts at 7 AM and ends at 7PM.  His future goal is to have his shop in a more strategic location and in a more comfortable environment, to be able to make an impact to his customer and feel comfortable doing his daily activities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, spark plugs, tires and electric cords.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
